In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 41 years old and married with two children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Teresita is engaged in agricultural business growing and selling pigs. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She is not engaged in any other line of business. Teresita is hands-on with her business. The return is quite good. The micro credit requested will be used to purchase feed and medicine for her pigs. Teresita plan to make her business bigger and the income generated will help her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine for pigs

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora,  tiene 59 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, Perú. Pisco se encuentra a sólo 28 metros sobre el nivel del mar y es un destino turístico importante para los peruanos adinerados, a causa de sus viñedos, su producción del Perú la bebida nacional de Pisco, y la proximidad de unas ruinas incas y la Reserva Nacional de Paracas, uno de los más famosos parques nacionales del Perú. Sin embargo, la ciudad estaba muy cerca del epicentro del devastador terremoto de 8,0 grados de magnitud que sacudió el centro sur de Perú en agosto de 2007. Más del 80% de la ciudad fue destruida, y después de varios años, la ciudad y su gente todavía se están recuperando de los daños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta leer libros ya que le ayuda a olvidad cualquier preocupación o si esta de mal humor;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Carmen le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “Caucau”; Carmen estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración. Carmen  es  madre soltera, su hijo tiene 15 años y cursa el quinto grado de educación secundaria.
						
Carmen trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanías, se dedica a este trabajo 11 horas diarias en la que puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hay mucho turismo en la zona donde ella ofrece.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella comprar mas mercadería, ello le  permitirá tener más variedad de productos  y así seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pisco, Peru. Pisco is only 28 meters above sea level. It is an important tourist destination for well-off Peruvians, because of its vineyards, its production of pisco (Peru's national drink), and its proximity to Inca ruins and to the Paracas National Reserve, one of the most famous national parks in Peru. 

However, the city was very close to the epicenter of the devastating 8.0 magnitude earthquake that shook south central Peru in August 2007. More than 80% of the city was destroyed, and after several years, the city and its people are still recovering from the damage.

In her free time she enjoys reading books, as they help her forget whatever is worrying her, or if she is in a bad mood. As is well known, Peru has some of the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes that Carmen really likes is the very tasty "Caucau" (a stew made with tripe and potatoes). 

Carmen went to school as far as fifth year of secondary, but she would have liked to have studied Administration. Carmen is a single mother. Her son is 15, and in fifth year of secondary school.  

Carmen works in her business selling handicrafts. She does this eleven hours daily, and can serve up to 15 customers a day. She thinks her business is doing well because there is a lot of tourism in the area where she sells.

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise. This will allow her to have a greater variety of goods, and in this way continue working to fulfill her great dream, "to have my own house."

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucina tiene 44 años de edad, se encuentra acompañada con el Sr. Nelson de 40 años de edad, ella es madre de dos hijos.
La Sra. Lucina se dedica a la venta ambulante de prendas de vestir nuevas y usadas como también calzados para damas y caballeros. Ella cuenta con una clientela totalmente formada ya que se dedica a dicho rubro hace más de 12 años. Ella anhela contar  en algún momento con un local comercial y de un vehículo en la cual realizar sus ventas y de ir prosperando como lo viene haciendo con la ayuda de sus dos hijos y para asi poder brindarles una vida digna.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, para que de esa forma pueda tener mayor variedad, pues tiene pedido con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Lucina is 44 and lives with her partner Nelson, who is 40. She is the mother of two children.

Lucina is a street vender, and sells articles of new and used clothing, as well as ladies' and men's footwear.  She has a very well-established clientele, as she has worked in this sector for more than 12 years.

She wants very much to have her own shop someday, as well as a vehicle to use in her selling. She wants her business to continue prospering, as it has been doing with the help of her two children, so that she can provide them with a decent life.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy articles of clothing. This will enable her to have greater variety, since she has orders she would like to be able to fill.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Rugiatu. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 12 years. 

In 1996, Rugiatu established her empty five-gallon rubber container business. She began her business because she wanted to support her children’s education, and this is her major source of income. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy empty five-gallon rubber containers for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to give adequate education to her children and to build her own store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more empty five-gallon rubber containers.

loans.name: Tatenda Zciea Group

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Charles from Mutare, Zimbabwe. He is married with seven children; two are attending school. He also cares for two additional dependents. 

Charles runs an agricultural business selling fruits and vegetables. The business has been in operation for 20 years. He says the main challenge he faces is a lack of capital. 

Charles has requested a loan of $150 to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the welfare of his family. In the future, Charles plans to be a supplier of fruits and vegetable to chain stores.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Levisarah

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Levisarah is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 17 years old. Levisarah and her husband sell fresh fish and crabs to earn a living. They have had this business for 10 years. Levisarah does her best to build their business and send their children to school.

Levisarah has requested this loan to buy a boat engine and more fish to sell. Levisarah hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Viola heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudan pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 27 years old, married to Florence and blessed with two children who are five and two years old, respectively. He sells mobile phone accessories, a business he started four years ago. He wants to purchase batteries at KES 10,000, phone covers at KES 10,000 and phone cases at KES 10,000 to sell.
 
Profit from his business will help him repay his loan. His dream is to open up more businesses for a better income and a comfortable life. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase batteries, phone covers and phone cases

loans.name: Robin

texts.en: Robin is a married man. He has a son who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be honest. He is involved in the business of providing transportation. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are local residents and patients of the nearby hospital. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase tires. Within the next 5 years, Robin's dream and hope is to own at least 3 vehicles for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 41 years old, married to Everlyne and is blessed with four children aged 15, 11, nine and four years respectively. He has a retail shop, a business he ventured into 11 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is also a boda boda operator. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a sack of sugar, packets of tea leaves and stationary to stock his shop. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay for electricity connection in his house. His dreams are to see his retail shop grow into wholesale as well as to educate his children. This is his first loan from KADET LTD.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of sugar, packets of tea leaves and stationary

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Nim, 33, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a motor taxi driver who earns approximately USD 5 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve his family’s economy, Nim is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase a piece of land in front of a garment factory to build a store for selling vegetables to generate extra income for the family. In the future, he would like to build a concrete house and support his children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to build a store

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 35 years old. She is a local farmer who has been residing in Kompong Cham province. She has been involved in rice farming since 1990. She has a life partner with her husband and has been blessed with 2 single children, who are currently attending school and living dependent on her income. 
She would like to request a loan of KHR 700,000 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay for a plowing fee. This loan enables her family to attain a suitable living. Sun wishes to buy extra farmland to increase a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van, 44, is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and breeding pigs to sell for over five years, earning approximately USD $5 per day. Her son is a truck driver who earns approximately, USD $5 per day. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Van is requesting a loan of USD $1,200 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. By doing so, her family would be able to live in comfortable conditions. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, aged 13 and 6. Merlinda's husband works as a Barangay official.

Merlinda sells cassava chips for a living. She has had this business for 6 years. Merlinda buys sacks of cassava to dry and cook. She then repacks the cassava chips to sell to her customers. Merlinda earns 20,000 PHP with this business. Merlinda has requested a loan to purchase fresh cassava and dried cassava chips. She hopes for her business to grow bigger.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cassava and dried cassava chips

loans.name: Sok Ry

texts.en: Sok Ry, 33, is married and resides with her husband and two school-aged children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately USD $4 per day. Her husband is a Tuk Tuk driver who can earn approximately USD $4 per day. In order to improve business, Sok Ry is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit for supporting the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be diligent. He operates a motorcycle, which he uses to provide transportation. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located next to a busy highway and his primary customers are local residents and passersby. In addition, Antony sells iron sheets to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent breakdowns of the motorcycle. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase spare parts for the motorcycle and iron sheets. He hopes and dreams of owning several motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and more iron sheets

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 49-year-old widow. She supports her three children, aged 16, 14 and 10 years respectively. She sells timber, a business she started a year ago and which earns her a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more timber for sale. The profit she earns from it will help her build more rental houses. Her dream is to give her children the best education. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for sale

loans.name: Tserendoljin

texts.en: Tserendoljin, 30, works as a janitress and lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger - a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent - in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for 6 years and wants to renovate her old house. She plans to make a repair to her old house in the coming spring months. It is very necessary to her family to live comfortably and warmly in the cold months. She thinks that after renovation, the house should become well insulated from the cold weather. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her workers at her brick-making site

loans.name: Esken

texts.en:
Esken has got a good credit history with KADET LTD and has applied for his third loan, which is a top-up business loan to buy more stock of maize for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to provide the basic needs for his family.

He desires to grow his business and open a wholesale shop for cereals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize for sale

loans.name: Banco De La Fe De Parral Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Banco de la Fe de Parral”, está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados al comercio, entre los cuales se encuentran rubros de peluquería, preparación de alimentos entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Teresa integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa su cabello largo y suelto, el cual es de color castaño oscuro. Además es una de las dos integrantes del grupo más alta.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería desde hace 13 años. Estudió en un centro educacional.
Atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa, en la cual presta servicios de corte de cabello, tintura y peinados. Por lo cual su horario es flexible, ya que además sus clientes la llaman para preguntar disponibilidad de lunes a domingo.
Sus insumos y materiales que necesita los compra e una distribuidora especialista en venta de productos para peluqueros, en la cual le hacen descuentos debido a la antigüedad.
Con el crédito comprará una máquina para cortar el pelo.
Una de sus metas es tener un local establecido en el patio de su casa, para instalar un salón de belleza. Comenta que ya postuló a un subsidio de ampliación en su casa, por lo que podrá concretar su proyecto en el menor tiempo posible. 
Teresa vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 3 años. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal, es tener su local establecido, ya que con esto podrá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad otorgada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Banco de la Fe de Parral” [Parral's Faith Bank] and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs involved in various trades related to commerce, including hair cutting/styling and food preparation among others. They are all residents of the city of Linares. 

Teresa, a member of the communal bank group who is located in the back row in the photo, second from the right, wears her dark brown hair long and loose. In addition she is one of the two tallest members of the group. She has been involved in the hair cutting and styling business for 13 years. She learned the trade at an educational center. She tends to her clients in her own home, where she provides hair cuts, coloring and styling. Therefore her hours are flexible, since her clients also call to inquire of her availability Monday through Sunday. 

She purchases her supplies and the materials she needs from a specialty distributor of hair salon products where she receives discounts due to her being a long-time customer. With the loan she will purchase a hair-cutting tool. One of her goals is to have a shop established in her home's patio area in order to set up a beauty salon. She comments that she has already applied for a subsidy for the expansion of her home, and so will be able to bring her project to fruition quite soon. 

Teresa lives with her husband and two children who are eight and three years old. One of her dreams of a personal nature is to have her salon set up, since by doing so she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her, since it has allowed her to invest in her business. 

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the country's central zone. In this area agricultural production stands out significantly, as well as the wine industry in the ambit of exports. In particular, cereal crops (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard and legumes) and fruits are grown. Linares is Chile's main rice-producing province; in fact, 78% of the nation's production of this grain  takes place in this province, especially in the municipality of Parral.

loans.use: to purchase a hair-cutting tool.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirtha es de la ciudad de Concepción. Ella tiene su pequeña despensa y también tiene ventas de ropas usadas. Nos comenta que gracias a la variedad que siempre tiene le va muy bien, puesto que ya pudo formarse una buena clientela.
Ella es una señora muy sacrificada, trabajadora que día a día está luchando con su marido el señor Eusebio para salir adelante y de esa forma poder tener un futuro mejor. Esta familia está compuesta por la pareja y sus tres hijos quienes todos ya van en la escuela y en el colegio. Mirtha nos comenta que sus hijos son la razón de ser de ellos, y es por estos que luchan incansablemente.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, arroz, fideo, panificados, legumbres y demás artículos de primera necesidad. Ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya, por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que le da a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirtha is from Concepción where she has a small general store and she also sells used clothing.  She tells us that thanks to the variety that she always has, things are going well because she could develop a good customer base.

She is a hard-working woman who, along with her husband, Eusebio, sacrifices every day by struggling to get ahead so that they have a better future.  They have three children who are in primary school and high school.  Mirtha tells us that the reason she works tirelessly is for her children.
She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, noodles, breads, beans and more staples.  She is very appreciative for the help from Kiva’s and The Paraguayan Foundation for this growth opportunity for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy staples to sell later

loans.name: Anjelica

texts.en: Anjelica is a single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as flour, sugar, salt and rice. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a conducive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of household goods. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more home products for selling. Anjelica's business goal is to expand her retail shop into wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products for selling

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Hellen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 27-year-old single lady from Vihiga who has one child. She operates a cafeteria and has been operating this cafe for the last six years, making a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy foodstuffs like sugar, baking flour and rice. She will use the profits to expand her cafeteria, so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

Her dream is to grow her business through KADET loans.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like sugar, baking flour and rice

loans.name: Mont Sinai Gs1 Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is a chairman of the Community Bank named “Mont Sinai GS1.” The group consists of five micro-entrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Alphonse is 61, married and the father of five children between the ages of 18 and 29. He has been active in his business since 1996. He sells sewing accessories at the market west of Kinshasa. He has been dedicated to his business, which is the only source of income he has to support his family. 

He is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received and successfully repaid 12 loans. Alphonse is planning with the coming loan to purchase items of good quality that are needed by his clients in order to generate more profit. With the next loan, Alphonse's group members will meet their clients’ needs and improve their business facilities in order to generate more profit to support their families. 

His ambition is to someday open a beverage facility in his area.

loans.use: to increase the stock of sewing accessories.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 34 años, vive en casa de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está casado con la Sra. Agustina de 37 años que es empleada de Crisvil, tienen 2 hijo,s la mayor se llama de 14 años y el menor de 1 año.
Gustavo se dedica en la fabricación de pantalones de vestir y bermudas, y su posterior distribución en las diferentes ciudades de nuestro país. Comenta que gracias al arduo esfuerzo que pone, y sumado a la excelente calidad de los productos que hace, ha logrado abrirse camino y hacerse conocido, lo que le permitió ir creciendo de a poco con su negocio.
Esta vez Gustavo acude a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual utilizará para la compra de una máquina de coser para la ampliación de su taller de costura, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como empresario.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 34 years old and lives in a house in the city of Paraguarí. He is married to Agustina, 37, who is an employee of Crisvil. They have two children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the younger, one year old. 

Gustavo devotes himself to making dress pants and Bermuda shorts, which he subsequently distributes in various of our country's cities. He comments that, thanks to his dogged efforts, along with the excellent quality of the products he makes, he has successfully paved the way for himself and become known, which has allowed him to grow little by little in his business. 

On this occasion Gustavo turned to the foundation and to Kiva to apply for a loan, which he will use for the purchase of a sewing machine in order to expand his workshop, and so to continue growing as a business owner.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Virila

texts.es:
La señora Virila tiene 50 años de edad, está casada con el señor Nelson quien es empleado de una empresa, tienen 3 hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá, tiene un copetín ubicado en su domicilio hace mas de 2 años.
Comenta que anteriormente era cantinera de una escuela muy conocida de la ciudad, pero lo dejó, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien la ayuda en el negocio actualmente.
La señora Virila solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, cerveza, jugo, también para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, panificados, harina, mandioca los cuales necesita para realizar sándwich de carne, empanadas de harina, mandioca y jamón y queso,  pues estos son los productos que más vende. 
Virila nos dice que está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues muchos no se la dieron, y esto representa algo muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
Virila is 50 years old.  She is married to Nelson, who works for a business, and they have three children, two females and one male.  They live in a well-known neighborhood in the city of Itá.  She has had a small restaurant in her home for over two years.

She tells us that she used to work in the cafeteria at a well-known school in the city, but she left that job.  Now she counts on the help of her daughter, who currently works with her at her business.

Virila is asking for this loan to buy beverages, such as soft drinks, beer, and juice, and also to buy beef, ham, cheese, baked goods, flour, and cassava.  She needs these to make beef sandwiches, flour empanadas, cassava, and ham and cheese, as these are the dishes that sell best.

Virila tells us that she is very thankful for the opportunity she is receiving, as there were many who wouldn't help her, and this is something that is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes and also to buy beverages in general

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a conducive area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of cereals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cereals for selling. Her business goal is to expand her store and open another similar retail store in the nearby town within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35-year-old widowed woman from Vihiga town, western Kenya, and is a mother of four school-going children.

Joyce operates a cosmetics shop and has been doing this for the last eight years, making a monthly income of KES 31,000. She is taking her sixth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more beauty cosmetic products for sale. Joyce will use the profits to provide for the family.

Her dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more beauty cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, a single parent living in Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh City, is a good housekeeper and a responsible mother of two children, both of whom are now working for a garment factory and earning decent salaries. Heng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase household goods and furniture to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase household goods and furniture.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one year. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children. All of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be a dedicated man. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be exploitation from milk dealers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cows' food and a milk machine. His business goal is to own 6 Friesian cows within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase cows' food and a milk machine

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is a 42-year-old man from Vihiga County, situated in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Irene and they have five school-going children.

Shem has been operating a poultry business for the last 15 years. The business gives him a monthly income of KES 15,400. He is taking his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy poultry feed and other poultry stock. He will use the profits to provide for his family (e.g. food and school fees).

His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and other poultry stock

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia forma parte del Banco comunal “Renaciendo al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la preparación de comida rápida, específicamente hot dog desde hace 5 años. Comenta que comenzó con el comercio vendiendo lencería y posteriormente cambió de rubro. Cuenta con un local establecido de comida rápida, el cual está ubicado en una ampliación que construyó en el patio de su casa.
Trabaja todos los días de la semana de 9ºº de la noche hasta las 1ºº de la madrugada. Comenta que vive en un sector donde existe mucha competencia, sin embargo sus clientes la prefieren, ya que cuenta con una gran cantidad de ellos.
Con el crédito comprará ingredientes preparar sus alimentos.
Una de sus metas es continuar con su negocio, ya que este le ha permitido mantener los gastos de su hogar. Además quiere ahorrar para comprar una maquina churrasquera.
Claudia vive junto a uno de sus hijos de 17 años de edad. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte comenta que éste es muy bueno y unido. Por su parte las capacitaciones, le han permitido aprender nuevas estrategias de organización e inversión.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Claudia is a part of the Renaciendo al Futuro Communal Bank based in the city of Talca.

She makes fast food for a living, specifically hot dogs, which she has been doing for five years.  She tells us that she started out in business selling lingerie, but that she later changed areas.  She has an established fast food stand, which is located in an addition she built in her home's patio.

She works seven days a week from nine at night until one in the morning.  She tells us that she lives in an area with a lot of competition, but that her customers prefer her and that she has a large number of them.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make her food.

One of her goals is to continue with her business, as it has allowed her to cover her household expenses.  she also wants to save to buy a grill.

Claudia lives with one of her children, who is 17 years old.

She is very happy with and thankful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it will allow her to invest in her business.  As far as the communal bank she belongs to is concerned, she tells us that is it very good and close-knit.  Furthermore, the training sessions have allowed her learn new organization and investment strategies.

Talca is in the Maule Region, which is located in the central area of the country.  It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, as it is the most important city in Chile's Central Valley.  There is a curious saying about Talca in Chile, which is "Talca, Paris, and London."  One of the theories about this saying is that it comes from something originally said by an Englishman, "Talca looks like London." This is because of all the fog that often covers the city in winter, much like the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make her dishes

loans.name: Las Juanas Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse por medio del trabajo en conjunto, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadora y desean poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Están actualmente en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Leoncia es una de estas mujeres, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de variados tipos de frutas de estación, con lo cual ella puede obtener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder tener un local donde pueda ofrecer las frutas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, para poder venderlas después, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Ten women in the city of Caacupé have come together with the aim of helping one another by working jointly. They are very hard-working women, and wish to be able to help their families by working jointly. They are currently in the first loan cycle of of the Enterprising Women program of Fundación Paraguaya.

Leoncia is one of these women, and she tells us that she sells various kinds of seasonal fruit. This has enabled her to obtain the means necessary to help her family. Her goal is to be able to have a shop where she can sell her fruit.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy seasonal fruit to sell, and so be able to continue growing. She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy fruit for later sale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in business for two years. She is 34 years old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Chelal

texts.en:
Chelal, 33 years old, is married to Janet and supports a family of four members. A land agent in Narok for the last five years, he earns a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

Chelal is now requesting his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. to help him acquire more land to develop and meet customer demand. He plans to use the profits to enlarge his business network, and his goals include putting more effort into his business, diversifying into large-scale farming, and improving his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to develop.

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es: La señora María actualmente vive por la localidad de Paurito desde hace mas de diez años, en la actualidad la señora se dedica a la fabricación de sombreros típicos de la zona oriental (sombreros e sao), esta actividad la viene desarrollando hace mas de cinco años abriéndose mercado y colocando toda su producción semanal. La clienta deja todos sus sombreros a sus clientes de los distintos mercados, ella produce y confecciona ochenta sombreros semanales. La solicitante agradeció por la oportunidad brindada y por la rapidez con la que se la atendió, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora todo el trabajo que realiza es de forma manual, por tal motivo tiene mucho trabajo,  el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material para la fabricación de sombreros y un equipo de sonido para su uso personal, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Maria has lived in the town of Paurito for over ten years.  She currently makes hats typical of the western region of Bolivia for a living ("sao" hats).  She has been developing this business for over five years, expanding her market and displaying all of her weekly production.  She drops off all of her hats to her customers in different markets.  She makes eighty hats every week.  This applicant is thankful for the opportunity that has been offered to her and for the speed with which she was seen served.  Maria is a very hardworking person and all the work she does is manual, which is why she has a lot to do.  She will use the money from the loan to buy material to make hats and a stereo system for her personal use.  She is happy and thankful for the opportunity she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy material to make hats and to buy a stereo system

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. All of them are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase clothes.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single woman. She has a son who is 6 years old. She describes herself as being obedient. She operates a tailoring shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be scarcity of clothes materials. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase clothes materials. Her business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes materials

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en:
Koleta is 40 years old and married without children. She lives in Yei and for the past year has worked selling fish. Koleta heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this will be her first loan from BRAC. 

Koleta is requesting a 400 SDG loan to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres trabajadoras es el grupo conformado por 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo lleva ese nombre, pues las miembros son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder darles a sus familias un mejor estilo de vida. Ellas se encuentran en el 5to ciclo, y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La señora Eliodora es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sandwish, y demás tipos. Ella comenta que se dedica a esto hace un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados, verduras y demás insumos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group is made up of 18 women from the city of Caacupé. The group bears this name because the members are very hard-working and determined women, who work very hard to be able to give their families a better lifestyle. They are in their fifth loan cycle, and want to be able to reach the highest level of the program. 

Eliodora is one of the group members. She sells food products of all kinds, such as empanadas, sandwiches and other kinds of food.

She says that she has been working at this for some time, so she already has a good clientele. She is applying for the loan in order to buy meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and other ingredients. With these, she will be able to stock her business, and that way be able to continue working and growing as a small business person.

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah has got a very good credit history and her retail shop is doing well, with good income.

The client has been issued with a business loan product where KADET Ltd. allows the client to take a top-up loan product to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 35 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000  SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang, age 37, has been living together with her husband and 3 single children in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province, where there is an attractive tourist area. Presently Seang works indoors as a housewife while her husband is a skillful carpenter. Thus, the main source of her income is generated by her husband earning an income of $5.00 per day to satisfy daily basic necessities.

With the requested funds, her second loan with HKL, she would like to buy raw materials supporting her husband in manufacturing furniture for his clients. For her business goal, she wants to own a medium shop for furniture made by her husband.

loans.use: to buy raw materials supporting her husband in manufacturing furniture for his clients

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida is a 26-year-old from Kisumu City.  She is married to Samuel and they have two children, aged four and seven.

Helida operates a depot selling bottled mineral water and soft drinks, a business she has been operating for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES 50,000.  

Helida is taking her second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of bottled water, bottled juice and soda for resale.   She will use the profits to increase her business stock. Her dream is to have a big depot in Kisumu town.

loans.use: buy bottled water and soft drinks

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 28-year-old man from Kisumu City.  He is married to Vivian and they have a seven-month-old child.

Alfred operates a clothes selling business where he  sells mainly jeans and trousers.  He has been doing this for the last seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 5,000.  He has been awarded his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more stock of jeans, trousers and T-shirts for resale.

The profits will be used to buy more clothing stock.  His dream is to have a big clothing business.

loans.use: buy jeans, trousers and T-shirts

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 63 years old and married. She lives in the village Napareuli with her husband and both of them are retired. The family's sole income is their monthly pension of 200 GEL. The family doesn’t have their own house and they live in extreme poverty. 

Makvala is requesting a Kiva loan to start an agriculture business. She will begin to cultivate her family's 0.2 hectares of land and will purchase maize to plant. In summer, Makvala and her husband will sell their harvest at the local market. They plan to use their additional income to purchase household goods that they don't have to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase maize to plant

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and single. He is from Kisumu City and currently only supports himself.  For the past five years, he has operated a business selling water and he earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Stephen is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD and will use his 60,000 KES loan to open another water kiosk. He will use his profits to open more locations. In the future, Stephen dreams of having a stable business.

loans.use: to open a water kiosk

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, tiene 55 años, tiene 5 hijos (4 hombre y 1 mujer), su esposo se dedica a la caficultura, reside en la comunidad del Cedrito, en el Municipio Subirana, Yoro.
Doña  Sonia tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos, cereales, productos de higiene y limpieza, medicinas, abarrotería y golosinas a través de una pulpería, la cual estableció con las utilidades obtenidas de la venta del café.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 12,500 Lempiras los cuales utilizará para surtir la pulpería con productos de la canasta básica y además aprovechar la temporada escolar con la venta de útiles escolares.
Doña Sonia es optimista, ya que mantiene su negocio en un lugar estratégico para las ventas,  por lo que planea a futuro lograr la estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 55, has five children (four boys and one girl).  Her husband devotes himself to growing coffee.  She lives in the Cedrito community in the Subirana municipality, Yoro.

Sonia sells basic grains, cereals, hygiene and cleaning products, medicines, groceries, and sweets in her grocery store.  She established the store with the profits obtained from selling coffee.

She is currently requesting a loan for 12,500 lempiras to stock her grocery store with staples.  She will also take advantage of the school season by selling school supplies.

Sonia is optimistic because she has her business in a strategic location for sales.  Therefore she plans to achieve financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and school supplies.

loans.name: María Paula Marina

texts.es:
La señora Paula, tiene 47 años, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, reside en la comunidad del Antigual, en el Municipio de Bonito Oriental, Colón.
Doña  Paula se dedica a  la venta de productos de la canasta básica y abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, maseca, carne de pollo, medicinas y productos de limpieza.
Inicio su actividad de venta de alimentos en pequeña escala, al transcurrir el tiempo, ha invertido las ganancias obtenidas para ver un crecimiento en su negocio.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la suma de 8,000 Lempiras, los cuales destinará a surtir más la pulpería y así cubrir la demanda alimenticia de sus clientes.
Ella espera obtener una mejoría en sus ingresos y para eso destina 14 horas diarias de trabajo continuo.
texts.en:
Paula, age 47, has three children, and her husband is a farmer.  She lives in the Antigual community in the Bonito Oriental municipality, Colón.

Paula sells basic needs products and groceries like rice, beans, sugar, lard, instant corn dough, chicken, medicine, and cleaning products.  She started her business activity by selling food on a small scale.  As time went by she has invested the income she got in order to see her business grow.

She is currently requesting a loan for 8,000 lempiras to better stock her store and cover the food demand of her customers.

She hopes to get an improved income, and to do so she works 14 straight hours a day.

loans.use: to buy food staples and chicken.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras es el grupo formado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son mujeres jefas de familia, que tienen a su cargo criar a sus hijos y proveerles de lo que necesitan para tener un futuro mejor. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio de este trabajo poder salir adelante y ayudarse las una a las otras.
Zulma es una de las miembros del grupo, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas hace ya un buen tiempo, y que por medio de esto ha podido ayudar a su familia. Dice que había empezado con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido crecer y estar donde está hoy.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser vinos, cervezas, energizantes, gaseosas y demás, ya que con esto podrá estar bien surtida.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Luchadoras" group is made up of 14 women from the city of Villa Elisa. They are parents, who are responsible for raising their children and providing them what they need to have a better future. They got together with the aim of working jointly, and through this work being able to get ahead and help one another.

Zulma is a group member, and she tells us that she has been selling drinks for some time, and that by means of her business she has been able to help her family. She says that she had started with a small business, but that thanks to her efforts and sacrifice, she has been able to grow, and be where she is today.

She is applying to Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for a loan, in order to buy assorted drinks such as wines, beers, energy drinks, soft drinks, and others. This will enable her to be well-stocked.

loans.use: To buy drinks for later sale.

loans.name: Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Buenaventura” está conformado por 23 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de perfumes, venta de lencería, venta de juguetes, venta de ropa usada y nueva, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Lo Espejo, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Valeria tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pié, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha. Usa su cabello tomado, el cual es de color castaño oscuro. Usa una polera negra sin mangas y en el centro es de color morado.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva de niño y adulto. Su mercadería la compra por docena en la comuna de Estación Central.
Trabaja los días miércoles, jueves, sábado y domingo en las ferias libres, el resto de los días vende desde su casa a vecinas y conocidos. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa escolar y útiles escolares, principalmente para el mes de marzo temporada escolar.
Una de sus metas es tener un local establecido.
Valeria vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad, uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es obtener su casa propia, para esto debe ahorrar y postular al subsidio habitacional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además le ayudado ha realizarse personalmente y compartir experiencias con las demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal. Respecto a las capacitaciones, comenta que le han ayudado a planificarse con la contabilidad de su negocio.
Lo Espejo es una  comuna ubicada en el sector sur poniente de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile). Cabe destacar que es una de las comunas con más densidad poblacional del país. El crecimiento de su población comenzó con la llegada de inmigrantes provenientes de otras regiones del país en busca de mejores horizontes, en los años ´60 y ´70, dando origen a importantes poblaciones que aun se mantienen, tales como José María Caro, Santa Adriana, Lo Valledor.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Buenaventura and it is made up of 23 enterprising members who work in different professions, such as perfume sales, lingerie sales, toy sales, and new and used clothing sales, among others.  They all live in the Lo Espejo Commune of the city of Santiago.

Valería, who is the communal bank's treasurer, is standing in the front row of the photo, the fourth person from left to right.  Her hair is pulled back and it is dark brown.  She is wearing a black, sleeveless shirt that is purple in the center.

She sells new clothing for children and adults for a living.  She buys her merchandise by the dozen in the commune of Estación Central.

She works at open markets Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays and she sells from her home to neighbors and friends all other days.

She will use the loan to buy school clothes and school supplies, mainly for the month of March in the school year.

One of her goals is to have a permanent place to sell.

Valeria lives with her husband and her six-year-old son.  One of her personal dreams is to have her own home, and to achieve this she has to save and receive subsidized housing.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  It has also helped her fulfill herself personally and share experiences with other group members in the communal bank.  As far as the training sessions are concerned, she tells us that they have helped her plan out her business's accounting.

Lo Espejo is a commune located in the southwestern area of the metropolitan region (where Santiago, Chile's capital is located).  It is worth noting that it is one of the most densely populated communes in the country.  It's population growth began with the arrival of immigrants from other areas of the country looking for better opportunities in the 60s and 70s.  This gave rise to significant neighborhoods that are still around, such as José María Caro, Santa Adriana, and Lo Valledor.

loans.use: to buy school clothes and school supplies, mainly for the month of March in the school year

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29-year-old mother from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City.  She is married to Kennedy and they have 4 kids, aged between 1 and 10 years.

Beatrice sells second-hand clothing and has been doing this for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy children's clothing, ladies' skirts and blouses.   She will use profits to educate children.  Her dream is to have a big boutique.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 28-year-old form Kisumu City, a town situated in the Western part of Kenya.  She is married to Samson and they have three children, aged three months, three, and five years.

Evaline operates a house decorations products business, selling window curtains and nets, and has been doing this for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 and is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more buy window nets and curtains for sale. 

Evaline's profits will be used to expand her business.  Her dream is to own a business premise.

loans.use: buy window nets and curtains

loans.name: Erika Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Erika, tiene 29 años, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 9 años de edad, es madre soltera, reside en la zona urbana del Municipio de Yoro.
Erika, anteriormente trabajaba en una bodega, hace 5 años decidió cambiar de actividad económica, dedicándose a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo.
Con su propio esfuerzo ha emprendido esta actividad, destinando parte de las ganancias a la surtir aun más su negocio.
Ya ha tenido experiencia crediticia, actualmente esta solicitando su tercer crédito por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los cuales destinará a la compra de producto nuevo.
Ella cree que administrando bien su préstamo lograra aumentar sus ventas y obtener una mejoría en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Erika, age 29, has two children, ages 2 and 9.  She is a single mother, and she lives in the urban area of the Yoro municipality.

Erika previously worked in a general store.  Five years ago she decided to change her business activity and sell perfume and cosmetics by catalog.  She has undertaken this business activity through her own efforts.  She sets aside part of her earnings to stock her business even more.

She has had loan experience.  She is currently requesting her third loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy new products.  She believes that by administering the loan well she will manage to increase her sales, and she will get an improved income.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alba Merarda

texts.es: Alba Merarda tiene 57 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general en lo cual este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante, ella visita a sus clientes para ofrecerles variedad de mercadería, además tiene pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes. Esta emprendedora inicio su negocio con fondos propios con muchos esfuerzos lo ha sacado adelante para poder crecer cada día en su negocio. Alba Merarda está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, short, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Alba Merarda is 57, and her business is selling general merchandise. She carries out her business selling door-to-door. She visits her customers to sell them a variety of merchandise, and in addition takes orders for what her customers ask for.

This entrepreneur started her business with her own funds, and with much effort has kept it going, so that she can make her business grow every day. 

Alba Merarda is applying for a loan, in order to invest in the business through the purchase of pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, and other products.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, and other products.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Damas Trabajadoras” tiene  casi  3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, todas ellas son mujeres muy capaces y por sobre todo trabajadoras, que se esfuerzan por mejorar el nivel de vida de sus familias y de sus hijos.
Lidia es miembro del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es un alimento típico paraguayo. Cuenta que siempre tiene buena venta, pues la chipa es consumida en época de frio y de calor. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma continuar ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de manteca, almidón, huevos, sal y demás insumos para hacer las chipas que vende. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, porque no todos se la querrían dar.
texts.en:
The Damas Trabajadoras Communal Bank has been training and working with Fundación Paraguaya for almost three years now.  They are all very capable and above all hardworking women who make an effort to improve the quality of life of their families and children.

Lidia is a member of the group.  She sells chipas, which are a typical Paraguayan dish, for a living.  She tells us that she has good sales, as chipa is eaten during both hot and cold seasons.  Thanks to the high quality of her dishes, she has been able to build up a good clientele who always buys from her.  Her wish is to keep growing and thus be able to keep helping her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy lard, starch, eggs, salt, and more ingredients to make the chipas she sells.  She is very thankful for the opportunity she is receiving because not everyone wanted to give it to her.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make chipa

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tortas y galletas,ella prepara para eventos como matrimonios,cumpleaños y bautizos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de tortas y galletas.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como mantequilla, azúcar, harina y utensilios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos  de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her business selling cakes and cookies. She prepares these for events such as weddings, birthdays, and baptisms. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm, and through this business she is raising her children.

Her dream is to expand her business selling cakes and cookies. The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy supplies such as butter, sugar, flour, and utensils. She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as butter, sugar, flour, and utensils.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.ru:
Юрий живет в городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Он работает пожарником в министерстве чрезвычайных ситуаций. Работает сутки через 4 дня, в остальное свободное время также подрабатывает ремонтом квартир. Работать приходится на двух работах, потому что только так хватает средств выжить с теми ценами, которые существуют сейчас в Украине. 

Юрию необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в квартире, куда они с женой смогут переехать после своей свадьбы. Юрий давно планировал съехать от родителей и расписаться со своей девушкой. Сделав долгожданный ремонт в квартире, они наконец-то смогут воплотить свою мечту в реальность и начать строить свою собственную семью отдельно. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yuryi lives in the city of Khoost in western Ukraine.  He is a firefighter with the Ministry of Emergencies.  He works a full 24-hour shift once every 4 days and in his free time he earns additional money by renovating apartments.  You have to work two jobs because it's the only way you can earn enough to live with prices as high as they are now in Ukraine.   

Yuryi needs a loan of 10,000 hryven (UAH) to be able to renovate the apartment where he and his wife will move after their marriage.  Yuryi has planned for a long time to move away from his parents and marry his sweetheart.  Once the long-awaited renovation is finished, they'll finally be able to turn their dream into reality and begin to build their own life together.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to renovate the apartment where he and his wife will live after their marriage

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 54 años de edad, es casada desde hace 38 años, tiene 4 hijos de 30, 29,26 y 16 años de edad de los cuales los tres mayores ya son independientes y la menor estudia, vive en la aldea Km. Arizona, Tela.
Doña Juana tiene un negocio de venta de ropa nueva. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace 10 años con fondos propios, con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo aportando un ingreso extra al hogar. Las prendas que ella vende son ropa interior para damas, sandalias y ropa en general como (blusas, pantalones cortos, faldas, pantalones etc.). 
Ella ha obtenidos varios prestamos con ODEF, los cuales le han ayudado mucho en la inversión a su negocio, del cual ha obtenido buenas ganancias, que le han permitido hasta poder hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
En la actualidad pide su tercer préstamo de 5,500 lempiras para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ropa interior para damas, blusas, pantalones cortos  y sandalias.
Su plan es ahorrar para poder brindarle un mejor estudio a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old, and she has been married for 38 years.  She has four children, ages 30, 29, 26, and 16.  The three oldest children are independent, and the youngest goes to school.  She lives in the Arizona village, Tela.

Juana sells new clothes.  She started her business ten years ago with her own funds.  She did this in order to help her husband and to contribute an extra income to the household.  The clothes that she sells are underwear for women, sandals, and general clothes like blouses, shorts, skirts, and pants, etc.

She has had various loans with ODEF, and they have helped her a lot to invest in her business.  She has gotten good income from her business, and this has allowed her to be able to make improvements to her home.

She is now asking for her third loan for 5,500 lempiras in order to buy women’s underwear, blouses, shorts, and sandals.

Her plan is to save so that she will be able to give her youngest child a better education.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear, sandals, and general clothing.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es casada su esposo  por motivos de trabajo se fue  a Santa Cruz tienen un hija de 3 años, ella realiza la venta de verduras en un mercado de  Cochabamba  solo los días de feria  tres veces a la semana los días miércoles, viernes y sábado, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras por mayor para vender en su puesto de venta, se levanta desde tempranas horas d la madrugada para poder comprar sus productos,    vive  en la zona de Tuscapujio Alto,  vive  en la casa de sus padres y esto le ayuda a reducir sus gastos ya que no paga alquiler pero si ayuda con los gastos del hogar, es una persona joven con el deseo de poder crecer en su negocio y así tener mas ingresos ya que esta es la única actividad con la se sustenta, se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is married. Her husband went to Santa Cruz because of work. They have a 3 year old daughter. She sells vegetables in the market at Cochabamba only on market days three times a week, the days being Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. 

With the money from the loan she will buy vegetables at wholesale to sell in her stall. She gets up in the early hours of daybreak in order to be able to buy her products. She lives in the area of Tuscapujio Alto. She lives in her parents’ house and this helps her to reduce her expenses. She doesn’t pay rent but she helps with the household expenses. 

She is a young person with the desire of being able to grow her business and thus to have more income as this is her only activity with which she sustains herself. She feels happy for the opportunity given to her as in this way she can improve the quality of life for all her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Un, age 49, has tried hard to raise her family out of poverty alone since she divorced her husband. She generates a living by cultivating rice on a few pieces of farmland in Prey Chor district. Presently, she has been blessed with seven children, some of whom help in earning the household income.

Un would like to take out this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve her farming business. In the coming future, Un intends to raise some poultry for additional income.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Jenny Senovia

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la elaboración de tarjetas  para distintas fechas especiales, como para el día de la madre el día del amor del estudiante del Padre, y ofrece en un bazar que tiene como también entregando a distintas tarjeterías, la Sra. Jenny es separada  tiene una hija que también colabora con ella en el trabajo, ambas se esfuerzan mucho por el salir adelante y se sienten felices por lo bien que les va en la fabricación y venta de tarjeta, solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como cartulina y variedad de papeles para la fabricación de tarjetas, la Sra. Jenny es una persona muy trabajadora y se  agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que brinda para seguir creciendo en su actividad y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de ella y de su hija.
texts.en:
Jenny works making cards for various special holidays, such as Mother’s Day, Student’s Day and Father’s Day. She sells them in a bazaar that she has and also delivers to various card stores. 

Jenny is separated and has a daughter that also collaborates with her in the work. Both struggle a lot in order to get ahead and they feel happy for how well the manufacturing and sales of the cards are going. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as pasteboard and various papers in order to make the cards. Jenny is a hard working person and she is grateful to the institution for the opportunity given her in order to continue growing in her activity and in this way to increase her income and therefore the quality of life for her and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy material and a variety of paper in order to manufacture cards

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей живет в Каменке с женой и маленькой дочкой. Он занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке земли. У Алексея есть две большие теплицы и еще 2 отдельные теплицы для рассады. Выращиванием овощей он занимается уже 4 года, до этого фермерством занимались его родители. На данный момент в хозяйство Алексей вложил 60 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 14 000 гривен. 

Алексею необходим кредит КИВА для того, чтобы закупить уголь на 5 000 гривен и семена на 5 000 гривен для поддержания тепла в теплицах и высадки рассады. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Алексей хочет вложить средства в дальнейшее расширение своего хозяйства: планирует поставить еще одну теплицу, поменять отопление и провести хорошие отопительные системы во всех теплицах. У Алексея – золотые руки. Он сам варит теплицы, сам проводит отопление в них. В доме и на огороде у него всегда порядок. Это вложение средств на самом деле поможет Алексею как добросовестному хозяину развивать и укреплять свой бизнес, обеспечивая семью всем необходимым.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexei lives in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya with his wife and young daughter.  He grows vegetables on his own piece of land.  He has two large hothouses and two separate ones for seedlings.   He has been farming for 4 years already, and before this, his parents also farmed.  At the present time Alexei has invested 60,000 hryven in his farm.  His yearly expenses for seed and greenhouse film come to 14,000 hryven.

Alexei needs a loan through Kiva in order to buy 5,000 hryven worth of coal to keep his hothouses warm, and 5,000 hryven worth of seed for planting.  Alexei wants to invest the extra profit in further expanding his farm.  He is planning to build another hothouse and install new heating systems in all his hothouses.  Alexei is very skilled with his hands.  He himself welds the frames for his hothouses and installs the heating systems.  His house and farm are always kept neat and orderly.  This investment of his extra profit will really help Alexei, like the good business man he is, to develop and strengthen his business, and thereby provide his family with all that it needs.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy 5,000 hryven (UAH) worth of coal and 5,000 worth of seed to keep his hothouses warm and for planting seedlings

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny, trabaja confeccionando ropa para mujeres de pollera en el taller de sus padres los cuales le pagan un salario mensual.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela para la elaboración de las polleras y de esta forma obtener más ingresos.
Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Obispo Indaburo la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Fanny works making women’s traditional Andean skirts in her parents’ shop, and they pay her a monthly salary.

She needs the loan to buy fabric to make the skirts in order to get more income.

She is single, and she does not have children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Obispo Indaburo zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, and the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make women’s traditional Andean skirts.

loans.name: Mujeres Idoneas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación y se encuentran actualmente  en el 13º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007, y quieren poder seguir trabajando juntas ya que la fundación le ha ayudado mucho con sus proyectos y también a mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Zunilda ella se dedica a la venta de ropas , tiene un local que alquila frente a la casa de sus padres y cuenta que gracias a Dios le va muy bien, pues tiene muy buena clientela. Su sueño es algún dia poder tener un local propio y de esa forma no tener que pagar más alquiler. Cuenta la Sra. Zunilda que solicitó el crédito para la compra de ropas, pues quiere estar siempre abastecida para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.Ella se encuentra muy agradecida ya que gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido pudo mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group came about through one of the members contacting the Foundation. They are currently in their 13th loan cycle, and have been working with the Foundation since 2007. They want to be able to continue working together, because the Foundation has really helped them with their projects, and also in improving their lives. 

Zunilda is one of the members of the group. She sells clothing, and has a rented shop opposite her parents' house. She says that fortunately her business is going well, as she has a very good clientele. Her dream is to someday have her own shop, and that way not have to pay more rent. 

Zunilda says that she applied for the loan to buy clothing, as she wants to be always well-stocked, so that she can offer greater variety to her customers. She is very grateful, because thanks to the help she has received, she has been able to improve her income and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing of all kinds for later sale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, es dueño de un gimnasio, es entrenador y tiene empleados que dan clases de físico culturismo. El gimnasio esta en un ambiente alquilado. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de otras maquinas de gimnasio (levantar pesas) para dar mejor atención a sus clientes y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a sus familia.
El es soltero y tiene un hijo, viven en una casa alquilada en la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José is the proprietor of a gym, and he is a trainer.  He has employees who give bodybuilding classes.  The gym is in a rented location.

He needs the loan to buy other gym machines (to lift weights) in order to better tend to his clients.  This way he will improve his income in order to support his family.

He is single, and he has one child.  They live in a rented house in the Buenos Aires area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of weight-lifting machines for his gym.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnacion surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación es un grupo antiguo y trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2006 se encuentran en el 19º ciclo. Ellas por medio del trabajo en conjunto han podido ayudarse y asi poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Elsa,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de bocaditos dulces, salados y tortas en general, y también su familia tiene un tambo y se dedican a la venta de leche.  Es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, se esfuerza siempre al máximo para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para  que no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Elsa acudió a la fundación y a kiva para solicitar un crédito, para la compra de insumos de repostería, como ser azúcar, manteca, dulces y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Ella al igual que sus compañeras está muy contenta con la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnacion. It came about through the contact of one of the members with the foundation. It is an old group and they have been working with the foundation since 2006, and they are in the 19th loan cycle. By working together they have been able to help each other and thus be able to improve their quality of life.

One of the members of the group is Elsa. She works making sweet and salty snacks, and tarts in general, and also her family has a dairy farm and they work selling milk.

She is a dynamic and hardworking woman, always putting forth the maximum effort in order to be able to give her family everything they need so they do not lack for any type of necessity.
