Elsa went to the foundation and to Kiva in order to ask for a loan in order to buy cake and pastry supplies such as sugar, butter, candy and other necessities in order to make her products. She, just like the other members, is very happy with the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, candy and other supplies

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny, es trabajador independiente y realiza todo tipo de trabajos en carpintería de aluminio.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un par de  habitaciones para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Johnny, es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Johnny is an independent worker, and he does all types of aluminum carpentry.

He needs the loan to build a couple of rooms to make his family more comfortable.  Johnny is married and has two children.  He lives in his mother and father-in-law’s house in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto.

This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a couple of rooms to make his family more comfortable.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue al trabajo de periodismo,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trbajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo,su sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in journalism. She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. Through this work the member is bringing up her children. 

The dream of the member is to improve her work. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy a television set for her house. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y produccion de zapatos,el socio vende en forma independiente,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos.El socio solicita el credito para comprar materiales para fabricar los zapatos como cuero y pegamentos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues to make and sell shoes. He sells them independently. He works from 8 am to 6 pm, and through this business he is raising his children. His dream is to expand his shoe-selling business. He is applying for the loan to buy materials to make shoes, such as leather and glues.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes, such as leather and glues.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, trabaja como chofer propietario en un sindicato interprovincial.
El crédito lo requiere para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para ayudar a su familia.
Félix, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos viven en casa propia en la zona Bautista Saavedra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez que trabaja con KIVA.
texts.en:
Félix works driving his own vehicle for an inter-provincial union. 

He needs the loan for repairs and maintenance for his vehicle.  It is the only source of income that he has to help his family.

Félix is married and has four children.  They live in their own house in the Bautista Saavedra area of the city of El Alto.

This is the second time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to provide maintenance and repair of his vehicle, which he uses to transport passengers between the provinces in the La Paz department.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es: Adriana  de 45 años es una mujer trabajadora que tiene dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 23 años. Ella con su microempresa de preparación de alimentos  ha logrado generar ingresos para sostener su familia. Ella es docente y en las horas de la tarde en la terraza de su casa,  ubicada al sur de la ciudad, vende papas rellenas de carne, queso, pollo, combinadas así como deditos y otros productos derivados de la harina de trigo, apoyada por su hermana y su padre, Su actividad de docencia la realiza en un jardín infantil cerca a su vivienda. Durante los fines de semana y festivos ella últimamente ha agregado nuevos productos como pollo al carbón y carne asada. Su negocio ha crecido y su clientela crece cada vez mas, razón por la cual su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para responder a la demanda. Su meta es lograr tener un local en un sitio diferente de su casa para tener mayor sosiego familiar y no extender sus jornadas productivas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos en mayores cantidades, un asador de mayor tamaño que el que usa y una vitrina calentadora. Con ello su infraestructura permitirá atender mas clientes de los que hasta ahora logra y obtendría descuentos por su compra en volumen, lo cual supone el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Adriana, age 45, is a hardworking woman with two children, ages 21 and 23. She is an elementary school teacher and works at a kindergarten near her home. 

Adriana has also managed to generate income to sustain her family with her small business preparing food. In the afternoon hours she sells potatoes filled with meat, cheese, and chicken, which are combined into "little fingers" or stuffed pasties, and other wheat flour products. She is assisted by her sister and father, and they sell from the patio of her home, which is located south of the city. 

During weekends and holidays she has recently added new offerings like charcoal grilled chicken and roast beef. Her business - and her client base - has grown every time, and as a result her capital turn around can't meet the demand. 

Adriana's goal is to have a storefront somewhere other than her home in order to have more peace for her family, and not increase her working day. Currently she is requesting a Kiva loan, initial financing done by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy raw materials and goods in large volumes, a grill larger than the one she uses, and a heated display case. This infrastructure will allow her to serve more customers than she is able to now, and she will also get discounts for buying larger quantities - all of which supports the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and goods in large quantities, a bigger grill than the one she uses, and a heated display case.

loans.name: Maximina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Maximina se dedica a laborar como secretaria de una Institución del estado desde hace muchos años, labor que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia conformada por dos niños y su esposo.

Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel han logrado mejorar un poco su vivienda, donde su objetivo consiste en acondicionarla para tener un buen ambiente para vivir con su familia, también resolver gastos personales a lo inmediato.

En estos momentos su objetivo principal consiste en resolver problemas de salud de ella por lo que necesita el crédito para invertirlo en medicina para poder recuperarse por lo que espera que Ceprodel le brinde siempre su apoyo y confianza en estos momentos que tanto lo necesita como lo ha hecho en los dos créditos anteriores que le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
The young woman Maximina has worked as a secretary at a state institution for many months. This job allows her to provide sustenance for her family, which consists of two children and her husband.

With the effort of her work and the loans that Ceprodel has granted her, she has managed to improve their house a little, where her goal is to air condition it to have a good environment for her family to live in, and also to immediately resolve some personal expenses.

At this time her main goal is to resolve her health problems, for which she needs the loan to invest in medicine so that she can recover. For this reason she hopes that Ceprodel will always offer her its support and confidence in these moments when she so much needs it, as it has done with the last two loans that it has granted her.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр с семьей живет в Гладковке. Он занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в тепличных условиях. На 80 сотках земли он поставил несколько просторных теплиц, в которых он выращивает 6 000 ранних помидор, 1 000 огурцов, 0.4 тонны картофеля, 6 000 голов капусты. Александр в этом бизнесе не первый день. Восемнадцать лет опыта дают о себе знать. За время занятия фермерством Александр многому научился и приобрел важные для сельскохозяйственника навыки. На данном этапе его оборотный капитал составляет около 84 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль – около 3 000 гривен.   

Александр обратился в КИВА за кредитом для того, чтобы приобрести семена на 5 000 гривен и агроволокно на 5 000 гривен для выращивания в тепличных условиях ранних сельхозкультур. Александру нравится работать на земле, высаживать рассаду и заботиться о созревании урожая. Он вырос в этой среде и не представляет себе жизни без своего любимого дела. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander and his family live in Gladkovka.  He grows early vegetables in greenhouses.  On 0.8 ha, he built several greenhouses where he grows 6,000 bushes of early tomatoes, 1,000 cucumber plants, 0.4 tons of potatoes, and 6,000 head of cabbage.  Alexander isn't new to this business.  His 18 years of experience show.  Alexander has learned a lot in his years of farming, and he has gained the expertise that is important to an agriculturalist.  At this point, his working capital is about 84,000 hryven, and his net profit is about 3,000 hryven.

Alexander has turned to Kiva for a loan to buy 5,000 hryven worth of seed and 5,000 worth of Agro-fiber, a crop covering for growing vegetables in greenhouse-like conditions.   Alexander likes to work the land, to plant seedlings, and to take care of the crops while they mature.   He grew up in this environment and he can't imaging life without his beloved farm.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy 5,000 hryven (UAH) worth of seed and 5,000 hryven worth of a crop covering for growing early vegetables in greenhouse-like conditions

loans.name: Las Autenticas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS AUTENTICAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora María del Carmen. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de tomates, tienda de barrio, venta de videos, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, costura de deportivos.

La señora María del Carmen,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, el mismo que aprendió de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, la capacitación y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Las Autenticas Communal Group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as a part of the Villa Adela focal center. Eight women make up its membership, and it is run by a director’s board headed by María del Carmen. The communal group’s members run a variety of businesses, among them are: tomato sales, neighborhood store, video sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, and tennis shoe repairs.

María del Carmen says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she became a member of the institution as a result of her friends’ invitation. Currently, she has a business selling vegetables, which she has been doing for some time, and which she learned from her mother.

The loan that she will receive is to increase her capital (to purchase vegetables), which she will acquire from wholesalers and later sell at her vegetable stand. This method of working will allow her generate income since she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center, the education opportunities, and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia  tiene 23 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja hace mas de 6 años, con el cual tienen  3 hijos pequeños que tienen1, 3  y 5 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de  Comidas, este es su primer en la institución, la Sra. Virginia usara este préstamo de  para Para la compra de mercadería para la  implementación de una segunda actividad que es una tienda de abarrotes razón para solicitar este préstamo es  para generar mas utilidades. Virginia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela  utilizara los beneficios Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Virginia  sueña para negocio prosperar y así tener mas ingresos   para dejarles una buena educación  a sus hijos, se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan para empezar otra actividad siempre en pro  de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Virginia is twenty-three years old. She is not married, but has lived with her partner for over six years, with whom she has three small children. They are one, three, and five years old. She sells food. This is her first loan with the institution. Virginia will use this loan to purchase merchandise to implement a second business, a grocery store. Her reason for requesting this loan is to generate more income. Virginia faces challenges in her business. They are to increase her customer base and also to utilize her revenues to improve her family’s quality of life. Virginia’s dream is for her business to prosper and thereby have more income to provide her children a good education. She is very happy and grateful to the institution for the support it is offering her to begin this new endeavor so that she may improve her entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to implement a second business, a grocery store.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Salvador  de 51 años es el propietario de un negocio de producción de postres, actividad aprendida de un amigo y que inició preparándolos para empleados de sus familiares, vecinos y amigos; así se dio a conocer y  fue creciendo  hasta lograr tener dos empleados, con ventas puerta a puerta; Su negocio ha tenido que enfrentar desafíos, como cuando le robaron y bajó sustancialmente su capital y también ha dado a él y a su familia muchas alegrías, porque con ello ha apoyado el bienestar de su grupo, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, hoy en las edades  de 27 y 29 años. En la actualidad tiene un gran entusiasmo por crecer, porque diariamente tiene más clientes y así su capital de trabajo, se torna insuficiente  para responder a la demanda y a su sueño de crecimiento. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas y equipos de trabajo, para ampliar su infraestructura técnica y así mismo su cobertura de clientes.
texts.en:
Salvador, 51, is the owner of a dessert shop, a trade that he learned from a friend. He began making desserts for people that worked for his relatives, neighbors and friends. That's how he became known and started increasing his business until he hired two employees. He makes sales door to door. His business has had challenges, like being robbed and losing a lot of capital. But the business has also given him and his family a lot of joy, because it has helped their well-being. His family is made up of his wife and two children, ages 27 and 29. 

Currently he is really eager to grow, because every day he has more customers and he doesn't have enough capital to meet the demand. For that reason he is getting a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use it to buy ingredients and work equipment so he can increase his technical infrastructure and also his customer coverage.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment to increase his technical infrastructure and his customer coverage.

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es: Miguel  de 51 años vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 36 años. El tiene un taller donde ofrece servicios de mantenimiento y reparación electrónica, actividad que aprendió cuando trabajó en un barco como ayudante en mantenimiento  eléctrico y electrónico. Desde allí su ti le regaló dinero para prepararse técnicamente y se radicó en la ciudad de Cartagena, empezando en su propia casa, donde aun se encuentra ubicado, pues cuenta con una gran clientela de clientes que ya lo reconocen. Su meta de crecimiento es muy clara y por eso quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará repuestos y materiales para responder a sus tareas de mantenimiento de equipos electrónicos y eléctricos. Su gran desafío futuro es adecuar bien su local para trabajar más cómodo y que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente confortable.
texts.en:
51-year old Miguel lives with his wife; he has four children aged 26 to 36. Miguel has an electronics service and repair workshop. He learned this trade when he had a job on a boat as an assistant repairing electrical items and electronics. After that his uncle gave him money to get the appropriate technological qualifications and he settled in the town of Cartegena. He started out working from home and still does so as he has a large number of customers who already know him. 

Miguel’s business goal is very clear--he wishes to grow his business so he is seeking a loan, the first one he has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He plans to buy spare parts and other items for his work repairing electrical goods with the money. His challenge for the future is to renovate his premises so he can work more easily, and his customers feel they are in a comfortable environment.

loans.use: to buy spare parts etc. for servicing electrical items

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 8 and 1, 2 of them go to school. 

Mary runs a food store business.  She has been in the business for 3 years. She has no employee.  Mary heard about Finance Sudan through the advertisement on Radio Miraya.  She is taking a loan of SDG 1000 to purchase more food items like tomatoes, onions, peanut paste and many others. In additions to this business, Mary’s husband contributes to the family too.

In 5 years time, Mary would like to hope for incrementing her business size.  Her major challenges include issues of school fees and home expenses,  though she supports the family with the help of her husband. 

Mary says that she has a lot of thanks for Finance South Sudan’s programme.

loans.use: buy food items

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 28-year-old mother of two children, aged 4 and 10 years.  She is married to Sylvester.

Jackline operates a tailoring business.  She has been doing this for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy textile material for sewing, threads and an extra sewing machine.   She will use her profits to expand her business.  Her dream is to own a tailoring school.

loans.use: buy sewing materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 30 year old, married, and has one child who is not in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to buy fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Mumbi Enole

texts.en:
Mumbi is still practicing farming in Narok with good returns. She has applied for a second  loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and to weed, spray, and irrigate her maize farm.

The anticipated profits will be used reinvested into her farm and also to support the family's basic needs. Her future dreams is to uplift her financial status.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed, spray and irrigate her maize farm

loans.name: Jennifer Jesennia

texts.es:
Jennifer es un mujer de 28 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de sastrería.

Su historia empezó como ayudante en una importante casa deportiva quien la ha capacitado en la confección de ropa deportiva siendo la ropa deportiva su especialidad, su trabajo lo hace sola el taller está ubicado en su domicilio, si tiene dificultades son las enfermedades de la lluvia, es casada y el esposo posee su propio taxi, si tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad.

Su sueño más importante es poder comprar una máquina de coser industriales y poder adquirir maquina y poder ampliar su negocio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de sastreríA comprar telas, hilos, herramientas.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 28, has aspirations that in the next few years her sewing workshop will prosper.

Her story began as an assistant for an important sportswear line where she was trained in making athletic wear, which is her specialty. She now works alone in a workshop in her home. One of her challenges is the sickness she gets when it rains. She is married and her husband owns a taxi. They have 1 daughter who is four years old.

Her most important dream is to be able to buy an industrial sewing machine and the get equipment so she can make her business bigger. That's why she wants a loan for her sewing workshop to buy thread, fabrics and tools.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Luisa Yajaira

texts.es: Luisa Yajaira de 35 años es casada, tiene 2 niñas en edad escolar, trabaja en la Escuela Tierno Galvan como docente desde hace 20 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que trabaja como mecánico en su propio taller ubicado en su casa de habitación y es quien asume con los gastos del hogar; esta solicitando su 8vo credito para la compra de materiales de construccion para hacer una tapia y asi brindar mayor seguridad a su familia y a su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Luisa Yajaira, 35, is married and has two school-aged daughters. She has worked for 20 years as a teacher in the Tierno Galvan school. She has the support of her husband who works as a mechanic in his own workshop in their home. He covers their cost of living. She is asking for her 8th loan to buy construction materials to make a wall and provide more security for her family and their small business.

loans.use: Purchase and installation of doors

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.ru:
Руслан живет в селе Малые Копани. Он занимается огородничеством. У Руслана есть жена и 8-летняя дочь Снежанна. На 135 сотках он выращивает в теплицах 5 000 ранних помидор, 4 500 огурцов, 3 тонны картофеля, 2 тонны редиса и 15 000 кустов перца. В сельском хозяйстве Руслан занят уже 17 лет. В хозяйство он вложил немалые средства, однако не думает останавливаться на достигнутом. 

Руслану необходима дополнительная финансовая помощь для покупки пленки на 7 000 гривен, семян на 8 000 гривен, удобрений на 3 000 гривен, а также 2 000 гривен для благоустройства теплиц перед новым сезоном. Руслан надеется сделать хорошее вложение в свой фермерский бизнес за счет средств, полученных от КИВА, и получить достойную прибыль от успешной реализации выращенных овощей.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Ruslan lives in the village of Maliye Kopani, where he is a market gardener. Ruslan has a wife and an 8 year old daughter, Snezhanna.  On 1.35 ha, he grows 5,000 bushes of early tomatoes, 4,500 cucumbers, 3 tons of potatoes, 2 tons of radishes, and 15,000 pepper bushes.  So far, Ruslan has been farming for 17 years.  He has invested substantial money in his farm, but he isn't thinking about resting on his laurels.

Ruslan needs help with additional financing to buy 7,000 hryven worth of greenhouse film, 8,000 hryven worth of seed, 3,000 hryven worth of fertilizer, as well as 2,000 hryven for making improvements to his greenhouses before the new season.  Ruslan is hoping to make a substantial investment in his farming business with the money he receives through Kiva and to earn a well-deserved profit from the successful sale of the vegetables he'll grow.

Note: story in Russian

loans.use: to buy 7,000 hryven (UAH) of greehnhouse film, 8,000 worth of seed, 3,000 worth of fertilizer, and to make 2,000 worth of improvements to his greenhouses before the new season

loans.name: Dionicio Rigoberto

texts.es:
Dionicio es un hombre de 28 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicios profesionales.

Su historia empezó cuando su negocio nació a raíz de su incorporación como administrador de empresas, su trabajo lo hace solo lo realiza desde las 7:30 hasta las 6:30 asunto relacionados con contabilidad y asesoramiento de proyecto de tesis, no tiene dificultades, si está casado su esposa es llevar su contabilidad a las empresas.

Su sueño más importante es tener un consorcio para administrar empresa, mejorar su vivienda y sus hijos que terminen su estudios profesionales. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para sus servicios profesionales comprando una computadora para sus trabajos.
texts.en:
28-year old Dionicio has many plans over the next few years to promote his professional services. His story began when he started his business as a business administrator. He works alone, starting at 7:30am and finishing at 6:30pm. He does accounts and gives business advice. 

Dionicio doesn’t have any problems. He is married and his wife does the books for various businesses. His most important dreams for the future are to run a business consortium, renovate his house, and have his children get a professional qualification. He is seeking a loan to buy a computer for his business.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.es:
Claudia soltera, emprendedora, a su corta edad tiene planes para su negocio que son aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus condiciones de vida optando así a un mejor futuro. Desde hace tiempo trabaja como comerciante de venta de muebles de madera preciosa. Iniciándolo con el apoyo de sus padres y siendo su medio de ingreso económico. Nuestra cliente necesita ofrecerle a sus clientes nuevos estilos y cumplir con pedidos, requiere el financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como: durpanel, galones de cera, bisagra, cerradura, blan, gypsum, pega de kleber, formica, barniz, cómoda de niño, comedores, entre otros productos que elabora y compra para vender a detalle.   
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is single and enterprising, and at her young age has plans for her business, which are to increase her sales and improve her quality of life by working towards a better future. She has worked for some time selling furniture made from beautiful wood. She began her business with help from her parents, and currently it is her means of earning income. Claudia needs to offer her customers new styles, and also to fulfill orders. As such, she requires financing to purchase raw materials, for example: particle board, gallons of wax, hinges, locks, blan, gypsum board, Kleber glue, Formica, varnish, children’s chests of drawers, and dining room sets, among other products which she makes and purchases for retail sale.
She is grateful to the financial institution for its support in developing her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the purchase and production of furniture.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Maria compró un enfriador , ella está satisfecha porque sus productos se tornan mas frios y deleciosos, ademas de tener mayor capacidad de almacenamiento útil para el refrigerado de las chicahas de maíz, bebidas y refrescos en general. Con el nuevo credikiva, al que está aplicando, planea comprar materias primas para la preparación de sus chichas y alimentos en mayor volumen, para obtener buenos descuentos que trasladará a sus costos productivos. Su agradecimiento a los finaciadores de Kiva y espera que la sigan apoyando, porque tiene mucho interés de crecer y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
With her last Kiva loan Maria bought a cooler. She's happy because her products are very cold and delicious and she has more storage space in her fridge for her chica, drinks and sodas. 

With her new loan she plans to buy ingredients in bulk to make chica and food, so that she can get discounts that will make her production costs go down. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders and hopes they keep supporting her because she's very interested in growing her business and generating more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk to make chicha [a corn drink] and lunches.

loans.name: Jacinto Javier

texts.es:
Jacinto es un hombre de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de mariscos. Su historia empezó debido a que todos sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad él aprendió desde pequeño y la convirtió en su profesión, su trabajo lo hace con algunos de sus hermanos desde las 05:00 hasta las 19:00, si tiene dificultades son las enfermedades , si está casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos.

Su sueño más importante es terminar la construcción de su vivienda y también invertir mayor capital para ser mayorista de cangrejos. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para comprar pescados, camarones para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Jacinto, age 25, is a man with many aspirations of growing his fish selling business in the coming years. His story began thanks to his relatives, all of whom work in this industry, and he learned from a young age what would become his profession. He works with some of his brothers from 5AM until 7PM. If he has difficulties, it's due to illness. Jacinto is married and his wife manages the domestic chores. 

His most important goal is to finish the construction of his home, and also to invest more capital in becoming a crab wholesaler. He wants this loan to buy fish and shrimp in order to earn more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNINAGBE est composé de vingt deux personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Joulienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Joulienne est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Joulienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Joulienne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges, Joulienne vend depuis huit ans, des fruits (bananes, etc..) et des noix de palme transformés dans sa région. Joulienne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Joulienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WANGNINAGBE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The WANGNINAGBE group consists of 22 people who are friends from the same village.  This is the second time that the group is requesting financial assistance from  ALIDé in order to increase its activity level.  Joulienne, raising her hand in the photo, is the facilitator of the group.  She is 33 years old and lives in Benin.  She never went to school.  She is married to a driver named Antoine.  Joulienne and Antoine have three children who all attend school and whom they financially support.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  In order to contribute to these expenses, Joulienne has been selling fruits (bananas etc.) as well as processed palm nuts, in her own region, for eight years.  Julienne buys her supplies in one of the regions of Benin.  In order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income, she and the other members of the WANGNINAGBE group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits and palm nuts.

loans.name: Mahu Doto Group

texts.fr: MAHU DOTO est un groupement composé de quatorze personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Berthe (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans. Berthe est  mariée  à un certain Valère. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Berthe vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Berthe a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Berthe vend depuis quatorze ans, des tissus et des chaussures de façon secondaire dans sa région. Berthe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, Berthe sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHU DOTO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHU DOTO is a group composed of fourteen persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Berthe (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 49 years old. She is married to a man named Valère. They have four children, all provided with schooling. Two of the children are dependents. Berthe lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Berthe halted her studies in secondary school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling cloth for fourteen years, and shoes secondarily, in her region. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of expanding her business, so as to be more competitive in the market, Berthe along with the other members of the group MAHU DOTO are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40 years old businessman, who lives in Juba.  He is married with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 2.  4 of them go to school. 

Rose runs a food store business and he has been in this business for 6 years.  He has 1 employee.  Rose heard about Finance Sudan through the advertisements made on radio Miraya and promotions done in the market by the officers.  He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more food items like, biscuits, milk, Nomi, and many others.  Besides this business; Rose has no other source of income.

In 5 years time, Rose hopes for an increase in the size of the business and to add more products.  His major challenges include issues of school fees and home expenses.  Rose says that, he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan’s program and he wishes God to bless them.

loans.use: To purchase more food items like, biscuits, milk, Nomi, and many others.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and blessed with four children aged 14, 9, 7 and 4 years old.  She has been selling new shoes for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000.  She wants to purchase more shoes for sale and has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000. 

The profit earned will assist her to pay school fees for her children as well rent and food.  Her dream is to expand her business.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme âgé(e) de 28ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur  et ont ensemble 02 enfants.
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse d’œufs  depuis 2007.  Elle vend à domicile dans un quartier de la place et achète à Lomé.
Ayélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle veut utiliser son profit pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé is a 28-year-old woman.  She is married to a reseller with whom she has 2 children.  Ayélé has been reselling eggs since 2007.  She buys eggs in Lomé, and resells them from home and in a local neighborhood.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan from WAGES.  She will use this loan to buy eggs, in order to better meet her customers' demand.  She would like to use her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Oltimpau

texts.en:
Oltimpau is 40 years old, married and supports a family of five people.  He has been in maize farming for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000.  He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET  LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep farming.  His future dream is to improve his financial stability

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married to Mercy and is blessed with three children ages five to one years old.  He sells food spice, a business he started two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

He has requested for a loan for KES 5,000 to purchase more spices for sale.  His profits will be ploughed back to his business.  His dream is that he import spices.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase more spices for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase building materials for her rental houses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating a taxi business and charging mobile phones for the last six years in Oloitoktok town. She is 43 years old and married to Peter. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add mobile chargers and service her motorbikes.

In the future, Elizabeth aspires for her business to grow, expand and generate more income.

loans.use: to add mobile chargers and service her motor bikes.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Jean Claude est né au Rwanda. Il a 27 ans et il est marié, avec 3 enfants de 1 à 6 ans dont 1scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Claude est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences des produits agricole, des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de chercher le marché pour ses récoltes. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Claude voudrait être un grand distributeur des produits agricole et être un agriculteur de profession. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Claude, 27, was born in Rwanda.  He is married and has 3 children ranging from 1 to 6 years of age.  One of his children attends school.  Jean Claude's education level is 6 years of elementary school.
Jean Claude is a seller.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy agricultural seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.
In order to ensure the growth of his business, his strategy is to look for new markets for his crops.  In the coming years, he would like to become a major distributor of agricultural products and a professional farmer.  With his profits, he is planning to send his children to school and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural seeds, chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. 

Amina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase onions and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Mirram

texts.en:
Mirriam has been practicing farming in Kalamba, Makueni town for the last 15 years. She is 36 years old and married to Joel. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET staff member. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase pesticides and to pay for the farm labor.

In the future, Mirriam aspires to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and pay for the farm labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
For the last 20 years Josephine has been practicing farming in Kalamba, Makueni town. She is 42 years old married to Muli. They have five children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy water pumps.

In the future, Josephine aspires to venture into several income generating businesses.

loans.use: to buy water pumps.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for one years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children. Three of them are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 26 year old, married, and has three children. One of them is in school. 

Susan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Rosalid

texts.en:
For the last two years, Rosalid has been operating a boutique in Rwaka, Kiambu town. She is 40 years old, married to Andrew. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. She paid her previous loans promptly. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase shirts, blouses, and skirts for sale.

In the future, Rosalid aspires to open another boutique in Kiambu town.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Jessica Ruth

texts.es:
Jessica Ruth tiene 22 años de edad vive en la ciudad de mala, ciudad presenta también como zona geográfica destacada, llamada "Los Platanales", constituida por terrenos antaño muy húmedos y salitrosos, donde afloraba abundante agua del subsuelo debido a la presencia de una napa freática situada a poca profundidad, que hacía propicios dicho terrenos para el cultivo de frutales como el plátano maleño y la vid. Se formaban en dicho lugar numerosos totorales (charcas con hierbas y cañas) y pequeñas lagunas formadas por agua que afloraba del subsuelo. La presencia del agua subterránea en la zona de Los Platanales permitía la formación de numerosos canales o sangrías que antaño albergaban una gran variedad de especies hidro biológicas, hoy casi desaparecidas, debido a la explotación irracional e indebida del agua, como buena peruana a Jessica le gusta mucho la comida y uno de los platos que a ella le gusta mucho es el riquísimo “Pollo a la Brasa”.

Jessica trabaja en su negocio de venta de juguetes y cuentos para niños, al cual le dedica alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al dia, le gusta mucho y nos comenta que a veces mira los programas infantiles para saber que juguetes puede traer para ofrecer a sus clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y sobre todo con los niños ya que por su edad son muy inquietos.

Actualmente Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar loncheras, accesorios y útiles escolares para ofrecer en su negocio ya que va empezar la temporada escolar y le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una librería Bazar”.
texts.en:
Jessica Ruth is 22 years old. She lives in the city of Mala, a city featuring a prominent geographical area called “Los Platanales” (The Banana Plantations) in days of old consisting as humid and salty, where abundant water emerged to the surface from the subsoil owing to the presence of a water table situated at a shallow depth, that made it advantageous for growing fruit such as Maleño bananas and grapevines. There were in this place many large “totorales” (ponds with grass and reeds) and little pools formed by water that surfaced from the subsoil. The presence of the subterranean water in the area of Los Platanales permitted the formation of many channels or outflows that in years past harbored a great variety of hydrobiological species, now almost disappeared, owing to the irrational and wrongful exploitation of water. 

As a good Peruvian Jessica loves food and one of the dishes that she likes a lot is tasty grilled chicken.

Jessica works in her business selling toys and stories for children, working about 8 hours per day and she can serve up to 30 customers a day. She likes it very much and tells us that sometimes she watches the programs for children in order to know the games she can bring to offer her clients. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly with her customers and above all with the children because at their age they are very restless.

Currently Jessica is very grateful with the Kiva loans and with your support she will be able to buy lunch boxes, accessories and school supplies to offer in her business as school season is going to begin and this will allow her to increase her income and to continue fighting to fulfill her big dream of having a bookstore bazaar.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (school season)

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years of age, married and blessed with four school age children. She is in the retail business, operating a sari-sari store, or general store, to earn a living. She has been running her business for over nine years and she operates her business proficiently and the primary returns generated from her business are very excellent. Rachel made a choice to join GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. She is applying for a micro credit intended to purchase grocery items to sell in her general store. Rachel hopes to make her business bigger and triple the return of earnings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to resell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es un mujer de 40 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su control de tareas en casa – Prof. particular.

Su historia empezó hace 13 años debido a que le resulto rentable en clases particulares y con el beneficio de estar en su casa con sus hijos, su  trabajo lo hace sola desde las 2:00 hasta las 6:00, si tiene dificultades ha sido el no tener una infraestructura adecuada, es separada, si tiene 3 hijos.

Su sueño más importante es seguir mejorando su casa para una mejor vida a sus hijos y algo de su capital para mas niños ingresen. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su control de tareas en casa, es decir mejorar el local donde da clases comprando cemento, pinturas, sillas.
texts.en:
Isabel, 40, has aspirations that in the next years she will take control of her work as a private teacher. 

Her story began 13 years ago when she realized it was profitable to give private classes, with the added benefit of being able to stay home with her kids. She works from 2 to 6pm. Challenges she have faced included not having adequate infrastructure. She is separated and has 3 children.

Her biggest dream is to continue improving her house to provide a better quality of life for her kids and to have more children enroll in classes. For that reason she needs the loan to take control of her at-home business and improve the area where she gives classes by purchasing cement, paint and chairs.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, chairs.

loans.name: Hosewell

texts.en:
Hosewell is 31 years old. He is married to Marianne.Together they have two children. He is a carpenter and has been in the business for the past six years. He gets a monthly income of KES. 80,000 from his business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase timber for use in his business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client.

His dream is to be a renown distributor of furniture.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Mujeres Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres sembradoras es el grupo conformado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida mejor.
Una de estas mujeres es Obdulia, ella se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido crecer como microempresaria y de esa forma brindarle a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y con mucha creatividad. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, también gomas y cierres, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mujeres Sembradores is a group made up of 12 women in the cit of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are hardworking and entrepreneurial and give 100% effort to be able to give their families everything they need to have a better life.

One of these women is Obdulia. She works sewing all types of garments, and says taht thanks to her work she has been able to grow as a small business owner and thus provide her family with a life that doesn't lack for anything. She is a hardworking and creative woman. Her goal is to be able to keep growing and keep helping her family.

She asked for a loan to buy fabric and threads, and also elastic and zippers, so that she can keep working and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other things.

loans.name: Baster

texts.en:
Baster lives in Yei. She sells food from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 34 years old, married and has no children.

Baster heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 Sudan pounds in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mosama

texts.en:
Mosama is a 44 year old business man who lives in Juba. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 19 and 4. All of them go to school. 

Mosama runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for 8 years. He has 1 employee. Mosama heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done in the market by the officers. He is taking a loan of 1500 to purchase more food items like, rice, Nomi (a brand of detergent), sugar, cooking oil and many others. In additions to this business, Mosama has no other source of income.

In 5 years time, Mosama would like to hope for a big business and many products in the shop. His major challenges include issues of low income and home expenses only.

Mosama says that he only has a lot of thanks giving for Finance South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more items like, rice, Nomi, sugar, cooking oil and many others.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children - three of them are still in school. 

Debora heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudan pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase electronic gadgets and spare parts for repair and sale.

loans.name: Nkitarri

texts.en:
Nkitarri is 59 years old, married to Danson and supports a family of 10 members. She is a mixed farmer and she has been in the business for the last eight years. Her monthly income is KES. 9,000.
 
She is currently applying for her third loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD, that will facilitate her to prepare the land and buy farm inputs. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and facilitate land preparation

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Deborah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for one year, and she works six days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market by means of retail. Deborah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals for her business are to own a delivery van to facilitate transportation and also to become a wholesaler. Deborah lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of $500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is the mother of five children. All of them go to school. With the loan, she will buy assorted items such as rice, cooking oil, and many other products for the boutique she has been running for the past five years. With the profits, she plans to put aside savings. She dreams of seeing her business grow fast in the future.

loans.use: to buy different items, such as rice and cooking oil, to sell in the boutique

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 48-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with seven children between the ages of 20 and 2. Four of them go to school. Sadia runs a retail store, and he has been in the business for nine years. He has one employee. 

Sadia heard about Finance South Sudan through the outreach and promotion done in the market by the officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds to purchase more food items, like salt, Nomi, sugar, sweets, cooking oil, and many others. In addition to this business, Sadia has his houses for rent as another source of income.

In five years' time, Sadia hopes to build other houses for rent. His major challenge is the issue of building materials being expensive in Juba. Sadia says that he is happy for Finance South Sudan’s program, which will enable him to build houses and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items, like salt, Nomi, sugar, sweets, cooking oil, and many others

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 36 years old. She is married to a house builder. Marie Claire has been selling cows for the past 19 years. She wants the loan to buy more cows to sell. With the profits from the business she will put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 40 years old. She is a widow with three children. All of her children attend school. She has spent 11 years in the business of selling shoes. With the loan, she plans to buy more types of shoes to sell. Marie Grace will accumulate more savings from the profits she will make.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Kholboy

texts.ru: Холбой проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его сын работает в школе преподавателем. Сам он более 20 лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа телят и овец.
texts.en: Kholboy lives in the region of Bohtar. He is 54 years old. He is married and has two children. His son works in the school as a teacher. Kholboy has been breeding large horned and small horned cattle for more than twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель района Хуросон. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Зафар более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков и коровы.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 28 years old. He is married and has one child. Zafar has been in the animal husbandry for more than five years. He mainly buys large horned cattle for future resale. He is taking out the loan to buy calves and a cow.

loans.use: to buy calves and a cow.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance, 25 years old, has a one year old child. With the new loan she wants to expand her cell phone business through buying more cell phones and accessories to sell. She plans to use the profits to make savings and to renovate the house. She wants to see her business prospering in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 36 years old. He has 2 children, between 2 and 8 years of age. One child attends school the other one is still young. His wife works as a teacher. He will buy beans, and sorghum to sell with the loan. Jean Claude will use the profits to provide food for the family and to make savings. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in yei. She sells food at a stall and has been in the business for two years. She is 38 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 in order to purchase onions, tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and married to Beatrice. The two are blessed with four children, aged 14,12,10 and eight years, respectively. He has been in the motorcycle transport business, locally known as (a boda boda). This is a business he ventured into three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000 to buy tyres, rims and other spare parts.The profit from his business will assist him in paying school fees for his children and providing them with the basic needs.

His dream is that one day he will buy his own lorry for transportation of goods. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy tyres, rims and other spares.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia lives in yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in the business for four years. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are still in school. 

Cicilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDD 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a mother of three children between 3 and 16 years old. Two of her children are currently enrolled in school. She sells foodstuffs and she has spent five years in the same business. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs to sell. Joselyne wants to save the profits as well as make big progress in the business for the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Yei. She sells tea and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. All of her children are still in school. 

Christine heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG to purchase coffee and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugarand coffee to sell

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  Nulu has a business selling bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for seven years and she works six days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market at retail. Nulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenge(s) for Nulu include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. Nulu lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Ngosoi

texts.en:
Ngosoi is 58 years old, married to Letaton, and blessed with eight children whom she supports. She is a mixed farmer and has been farming for the last 7 years. Her monthly income is KES 12,000. She has applied for a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD and she plans to use this loan to prepare her farm and purchase farm inputs.

Ngosoi intends to use the profits to diversify into keeping livestock. Her future dream is to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and prepare her farm.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, four of whom are in school.  Mariam has a beauty salon business.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Mariam sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Mariam has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair dryer, weaves and braids. She also generates additional income through selling maize bran and soda.

The main business challenges for Mariam include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked beauty salon. Mariam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair dryer, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 35 years old and married with six children. None of the children is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Lucia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.ru: Khuraman 56 let, ona zamujem i u nee troe vzroslix detey. Ona 18 let zanimaetsa skotovodstvom. Prodaet baraninu i sherst na bazare. Ee semya jivet v poselke dla bejencov i na segodnashniy den s doxodov svoego dela oni delayut remont u seba doma. Ona staraetsa uvelichit chislo jivotnix dla rasshirenia biznesa. Khuraman obratilas za kreditom v 1000 AZN na pokupku mebeli dla doma.
texts.en: Khuraman is 56 years old, she is married and has three grown children. She has been in the animal husbandry business for eighteen years. She sells lamb meat and wool on the market. Her family lives in the village for refugees and now they are using the profit from their business to renovate their home. She tries to increase the number of cattle to expand the business. Khuraman has asked for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the home.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 35 years old and married with six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Angelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Maua, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running a beauty salon for seven years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use this loan to restock the missing salon equipment and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy women's handbags and shoes. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy women's handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an industrial-quality stove

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Hellen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and only child. He’s their main source of income and their only support. 

He opened his own bakery in 1996. He’s a reputable man, well-known for his delicious food. Today, he’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added raw materials for his bakery, such as salt, flour and many other items. He notes that this will improve his work, and therefore, boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to renovate and expand his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase added raw materials for his bakery, such as salt, flour and many other items.

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Dib is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children; two of them are studying.  He strives to work really hard in order to cover his family expenses. For this reason, he decided to double his effort and take on more projects as he works on a free-lance-basis. He started his own business as a painter in 2006. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added painting tools in order to be able to start his new project or else he won’t be capable of carrying on his work properly. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to buy added painting tools in order to be able to start his new project

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a trisikad (pedicab) rental business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for trisikad maintenance.

Susana has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for trisikad (pedicab) maintenance

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja is forty-six years old and married with two children.

Aleja works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling scrap in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of scrap to sell.

Aleja has borrowed and paid for twenty-four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling scrap for twelve years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Aleja aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of scrap to sell.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi is sixty-five years of age and is married with six children.

Komi owns & operates a small clothing business sewing both men and womens clothing for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Komi needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase additional inventory such as more fabrics and materials & use as working capital.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 1250 talas or US $521 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Komi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Komi's 7th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Petesa

texts.en:
Petesa is 26 years old. She is married and has one child.

Petesa owns and operates a business venture selling specialty food products in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Petesa needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Petesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Petesa 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Folole

texts.en:
Folole is twenty-seven years of age and is married with two children.

She owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has six years of experience in this business.  

Folole needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Folole joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Folole's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new food items to increase her store's inventory.

loans.name: Toga

texts.en:
Toga is a married thirty-five-year-old woman with one child. She runs a small business venture, selling peanuts in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Toga needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 300 Talas per week) to continue improving her business.

Toga  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Toga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en:
Luaupu is a married thirty-four-year-old mother with eight children. Her oldest child is sixteen years old and her youngest is two years old. She runs a small business, selling baked goods in the local community. She has five years of experience with this venture. Luaupu needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 Talas per week) to continue to improve the business.

In 2007, Luaupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Luaupu's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Ашур проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет средне – специальное образование. Ашур предоставляет услугу, он занимается ремонтом обуви. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения резины, кожи и других необходимых материалов.
texts.en:
Ashur lives in the Yavan region. He is 59 years old, and married. He has five children. He has specialized (vocational) secondary education. 

Ashur provides a service, he repairs shoes. He has been engaged in this type of business for more than 15 years. He takes a loan for the purchase of rubber, leather and other materials required.

loans.use: to purchase rubber, leather and other materials required

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She works in her family's business, selling dried goods and snacks in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience doing this. Sue needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Sue joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sue's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale, such as corn to make popcorn.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Абдурасул разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом зерновых культур. В этой области он шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и посева пшеницы, фасоли и гороха.
texts.en:
Abdurasul lives in the Rudaki region. He is 36 years old, and married. He has six children. He has a high school education. 

Abdurasul breeds cattle at his home. He mainly breeds cattle for selling later on. In addition, he works with growing vegetables and planting crops. He has been working in this field for six years. He takes a loan for the purchase of cows and seeds for crops of wheat, beans and peas.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and cereal crops

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат проживает в районе Пяндж. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. У нее семеро детей. Она занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Sabohat lives in the Pyandj region. She is married. She is 43 years old, and has seven children. 

Sabohat works with livestock. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years. She takes a loan for the purchase of sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Kandahar Group

texts.en:
Hidaya, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a business of selling Irish potatoes for 9 years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the stock of the Irish potatoes, household expenses(hospital treatment and visiting patients,food for her family, emergency like going to places like funeral attendance)   and has paid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kandahar" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. (One client was on the telephone so her face could not be seen.)

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
flor es un mujer de 47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su taller de sastrería. 

Su historia empezó a raíz de la separación de su primer compromiso se vio en la necesidad de aprender un oficio fue así que con cursor de sastrería emprendió su propio negocio especialmente cada cierto tiempo, su trabajo lo hace solo el taller está ubicado en su domicilio y el horario es de 8:00 hasta las 18:00, si tiene dificultades son las enfermedades, es viuda, si tiene hijos todos son mayores de edad.

Su sueño más importante es poder ampliar su taller y poder contar con ayudantes. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su taller de sastrería comprar telas, hilos, herramientas.
texts.en:
Flor is a 47-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her dressmaking business over the next few years.

Flor's business story began when she separated from her first partner.  She needed to learn a trade and so she took a course in dressmaking and set up her own business.  She works alone and her workshop is located in her home.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  The difficulties that she experiences are illnesses.  Flor is a widow and all of her children are adults.
