Flor's biggest dream is to expand her workshop and employ helpers.  She is requesting this loan for her dressmaking workshop, to buy fabric, thread and tools.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and tools

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 37 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia comenzó en este negocio porque quise ser independiente ya que tiene hijos mayores de edad y la animaron a ponerse un comedor ya que cocina muy bueno,  trabaja sola, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 3 hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño es tener un local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida comprando arroz, vegetales, legumbres.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business over the next few years.

Rosa started out in business because she wanted to be independent.  Her children are now adults and they encouraged her to set up an eatery because she cooks really well.  She works alone and does not experience any difficulties.  She is not married and her three children are grown up.  Her dream is to own premises.  She is requesting this loan for her food business and will buy rice and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetables

loans.name: Jessica Virginia

texts.es:
Jessica es un mujer de 32 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó con poca mercadería ahora tiene mucho mas ella escogió esta actividad porque le gusto vender , su trabajo lo hace muy organizado y sola en el horario de 8:00AM hasta las 3:00PM, no tiene dificultad, no está casada, si tiene 2 hijos entre 4 y 6 años de edad y estudian en colegio fiscal.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio y tener su propio local para darle un futuro a sus hijos. Por eso es que quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de ropa como pantalones, blusas, aretes.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 32-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her sales business over the next few years.

Jessica started out with a small amount of merchandise but now she has a lot more.  She chose this business because she enjoys selling things.  She works alone, in a very organized manner.  She works from 8.00am to 3.00pm and does not experience any difficulties.  She is not married and has two children between 4 and 6 years old who are studying at a state school.

Jessica's dream is to continue expanding her business and to own her own premises so that she can provide her children with a good future.  She would like this loan to invest in her clothes business.  She will buy pants, blouses and earrings.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and earrings

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 24 años, vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus hermosas playas, así como también por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo por la sazón que tienen sus pobladores para la preparación de sus platillos, por ello uno de los platos que más le gusta a Manuel es la riquísima “Carapulcra”, el solo estudio hasta quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería electrónica ya que le gusta reparar artefactos eléctricos, está casado y junto a su esposa  tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 1,5,6 años, su esposa se dedica al hogar y también trabaja Confeccionando y tejiendo esteras.

Manuel trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, labora alrededor de 15 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 60 clientes en el día, se levanta muy temprano para poder iniciar su trabajo, algunas veces no toma desayuno por salir temprano y aprovechar a los clientes que se van a su centro de labores para ofrecerles sus servicios, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque aprovecha al máximo su tiempo para trabajar, es honrado y cobra una tarifa cómoda para los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene que salir adelante para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que son los mas importante que el tiene y por los cuales daría su vida.

Manuel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, así como también poder apoyar a su esposa para comprar material para tejer esteras, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo seguro y también que su esposa pueda tener el material necesario para su trabajo, así seguirán luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:”Darle una profesión a sus hijos y que tengan una buena calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Manuel is 24 years old and lives in the city of Chincha which is noted for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches and because it is the birthplace of some Peruvian sporting greats.  Above all, it is known for the tasty dishes prepared by the local people.  One of the dishes that Manuel enjoys the most is the delicious 'carapulcra' (a spicy Peruvian stew).  Manuel only studied up to the fifth year of his secondary education but he would have liked to have studied Electronic Engineering because he enjoys fixing electrical appliances.  He is married and has three children with his wife who are 1, 5 and 6 years old.  His wife takes care of their home and also works weaving mats.

Manuel works as a motorcycle taxi driver.  He works around 15 hours a day and can serve up to 60 customers a day.  He gets up very early to start work.  Sometimes he doesn't have breakfast so that he can get out early and make the most of the customers who are going to work, offering them his services.  He believes that his business is doing well because he makes the most of his time to work, he is honest and he charges his customers an affordable fare.  Above all, he must do well so that he can provide for his children as they are the most important thing in the world to him and he would give his life for them.

Manuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to your support, he will be able to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle and will also be able to support his wife by purchasing material for her to weave her mats with.  This means that Manuel will have a safe vehicle and his wife will be able to have the material she needs for her work.  In this way, they will continue working hard to provide for their children and be able to fulfill their biggest dream, to give their children a profession and ensure they have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle and to buy material

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 38-year-old married woman with one child in school.  Her business is selling fish in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for  two years.

Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, who all attend school.  Her business is selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Veronika is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Pilar

texts.en: Cecilia is a twenty-eight-year-old single mother. She lives alone with her ten-year-old daughter and describes herself as a hard-working but happy person.  She learned embroidery at age thirteen, when she would come home from school and help her mother finish her projects. She now earns a living from the tablecloths, table runners, and towels that she cross-stitches by hand. Her business is doing well so far, thanks to the previous microloans she has taken out and successfully paid off. She now hopes that this new loan will help her buy more materials essential to her craft such as cloth, needles, and colorful thread. Cecilia dreams of one day earning enough money to buy a little home where she and her daughter can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy materials for her embroidery.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Vya Renda cuenta con trece integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en equipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que su lucha sea su mayor fortaleza.
Petrona es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y cuenta que gracias a su trabajo y a su habilidad para las ventas ha podido crecer y salir adelante. Cuenta que su secreto del éxito es estar inspirada, y esa inspiración para ella es su familia, ya que ella lucha por ellos siempre.
Solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de prendas de verano, como ser camisillas, remeras, pantalones, shorts y demás, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Vya Renda' and it has thirteen members.  Each member has a small business activity which they work in, no matter how small it may be.  The ladies feel very enthusiastic.  They are constantly helping each other and they are inspired by the desire to continue working hard for their families.  Their teamwork and the fact that they use all the resources available to them means that their hard work is their greatest strength.

Petrona is one of the members of this group.  Her business is selling clothing and she says that, thanks to her work and her sales skills, she has been able to grow her business and do well.  She says that the secret to success is to be inspired and her inspiration is her family as she always works hard for them.  She is requesting the help of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to buy summer clothing such as t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc.  This will be very helpful to her as she will be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA SOFIA RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LA CHILEZA DESDE HACE YA VARIO TIEMPO DEDICANDOSE DURANTE 30 AÑOS A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA DE PAN, ROSQUILLA, QUESADILLAS Y TAMALES SUS VENTAS SON DE MANERA AMBULANTE ESTA SOLICITANDO LPS3.000.00, ESTE DINERO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN COMPRA DE HARINA, HUEVOS, CUAJADA, ETC 
DOÑA SOFIA ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA Y CON DESEOS DE SALIR ADELANTE SU SUEÑO ES QUE SU FAMILIA ESTE BIEN. SU META  ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sofia has lived in the community of La Chileza for some time.  For thirty years she has been making and selling bread, donuts, quesadillas and tamales.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.  She is requesting 3,000 lempira which she needs to invest in buying flour, eggs, curds, etc.  

Sofia is an entrepreneurial person who has a desire to get ahead in life.  Her dream is for her family to be well.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and other supplies that she uses to make her products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school.She also takes care of additional family members - her parents. Mary has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days a week. Mary sells her products in her shop, by means of retail. Mary has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bundles of mats, baskets and hand woven caps. She also generates additional income by selling charcoal.

The main business challenges for Mary include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease in transportation. Mary lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of mats, hand woven caps and baskets.

loans.name: Tajy Punta Group

texts.es:
Tajy Punta es denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 2°ciclo con 13 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para fomentar su compañerismo.
La señora Corina es madre soltera de 4 hijos pequeños y ha luchado mucho para sacarlos adelante y gracias a esta oportunidad brindada por la fundación y por kiva, sabe que podrá salir adelante. Ella es artesana, y se dedica al bordado de sabanas, sobrecamas y demás.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas para el bordado que tiene. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
'Tajy Punta' is the name of this committee who are in their second loan cycle with thirteen members.  This is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies.  They each work in their own business activity but they also work together to foster team spirit.

Corina is a single mother with four young children.  She has worked hard to provide for them and, thanks to this opportunity from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, she knows that she will be able to get ahead in life.  Corina is a craftswoman and her business is embroidering sheets, bedspreads, etc.

Corina is requesting a loan to buy fabric and threads for the embroidery that she does.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, her sister's children. 

Victo has as a business a retail shop. She has been in this business for a year, and she works seven days a week. Victo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Victo has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt, bags of sugar and jerycans of cooking oil.     

The main business challenges for Victo include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van to ease transportation. Victo lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and jerycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Laura Pastora

texts.en: Laura is a forty-five-year-old married mother of three. She describes herself as a cheerful and energetic person who doesn't mind hard work. She learned to embroider by hand when she was only five-years-old. After many years of practice, she has now honed her skill and is able to produce many beautiful tablecloths and runners. Demand for her work is steady, and she hopes that with this loan, she will be able to improve on the quality of cloth she uses to produce her pieces, and perhaps earn a little more money. She dreams of one day owning her own embroidery shop where she can produce a greater number of pieces in a shorter amount of time.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.en: Rosa is twenty-seven years old and the mother of two children, ages seven and one. She is a happy and friendly person who loves to work on her embroidery. Rosa learned the craft from her friends and she now works on her pieces full time, creating colorful tablecloths by hand. She works alone and her tablecloths sell well, which is why she hopes to buy more materials with this loan, thus increasing her production and raising her revenues. Rosa's children depend on the income generated from the sale of her pieces, and so she doesn't mind working hard as long as her kids are happy and have a stable life. She dreams of one day earning enough to buy her own home and give her kids a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 1 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is one of the members of her group named Primera Persona 1 (First Person). This is a group made up of five businesspeople women and men, dedicated to doing business all over their rural community, in the city of Hato Mayor. Mayra is a mother of two children and they live together with her and their father. 

For about ten years, Mayra has had a beauty salon which she started with the first loan she took with Esperanza International. She has improved her business with every loan she has taken with Esperanza. This is her sixteenth loan. She plans to use this loan to buy different hair and beauty product lines.

Mayra's story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JUAN MANUEL VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 2 HIJOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION UBICADA EN LA ALDEA LA CHILEZA DEDICANDOSE A VARIAS ACTIVIDADES COMO SER CRIA DE GANADO, FLETES, VENTA DE FRUTAS DE LA EPOCA SOLICITA A PRISMA UN PRESTAMO DE LPS 5,000.00 PARA COMPRA DE SANDIA YA QUE ES LA FRUTA QUE SE DA EN ESTA EPOCA Y QUIERE APROVECHAR LA TEMPORADA. DON JUAN ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA DEDICADA A SU TRABAJO DESEA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ENTRE MAS LE INVIERTE MEJORES SON SUS UTILIDADES. EL SUEÑO DE DON JUAN ES MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA Y LAS DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Juan Manuel lives with his wife and two children in their home which is located in the small village of La Chileza.  He carries out a number of different business activities such as raising livestock, providing transportation services and selling seasonal fruit.  He is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempira from Prisma to buy watermelons as they are in season right now and he wants to make the most of this.  Juan is a hard-working person who is committed to his work.  He would like to invest in his business because the more he invests, the greater his profits are.  Juan's dream is to improve his own living conditions as well as those of his family.

loans.use: to make the most of harvest season and stock up with watermelons

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  tiene 21 años es soltera, vive con sus padres en la compañía Tajy Loma de la Ciudad Carapeguá.
Ella es tejedora y macatera, desde muy joven se dedica a estos dos trabajos que le deja un buen ingreso, aprendió a tejer con su mamá,  ya que ésta se dedica hace 25 años a dicha profesión, y suele ir de macate con su papá, por la ciudad de Formosa, donde viajan a llevar sus productos a vender. 
Vende también sus productos por Carapeguá ya que estos son   de muy buena calidad. Sus vecinos dicen que es responsable y trabajadora, valores importantes para el progreso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, colores, trapos para tejer, ya que los necesita para poder trabajar. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo por parte de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in Tajy Loma, in the city of Carapeguá.

Maria is a weaver and rural saleswoman.  She has been in these two businesses since she was very young and they make her good income.  She learned to weave from her mom who has been in this business for 25 years and she usually goes out selling with her dad in the town of Formosa.  They travel there with their products to sell.  

Maria also sells her products in Carapeguá as they are very good quality.  Her neighbors say that she is responsible and hard-working, which are important values for making progress.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy threads, dyes and rags for her weaving as she needs them to be able to work.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, rags, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is a 36-year-old mother of two.  She is a very happy and optimistic person who works hard to provide for her family.  She makes a living embroidering tablecloths and table runners by hand, and selling them from her stand in Otavalo, Ecuador.  Her mom taught her the craft when Guadalupe was fifteen years old, and she has been doing it professionally ever since.  Her sales have gone well so far, which is why she hopes to purchase a greater quantity of better quality materials with this loan.  Guadalupe dreams of one day owning a store from which to sell her pieces, and to make enough money to send her kids to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.en: Maria is a 29-year-old mother of four.  She describes herself as an honest and energetic person who works hard in order to provide for her children.  She learned to embroider by hand about ten years ago from her friends, and she now creates tablecloths and runners which she then sells.  Although her business is doing well, Maria would like to increase her output, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy more materials of better quality.  With the money she will hopefully earn from future sales, she plans to fix up the little home she shares with her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Nulu has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Nulu has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Nulu include transportation, thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale business and a delivery van to ease transportation. Nulu lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Rayo de Luz (Ray of Light) 3. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with five of her six children. A widowed mother for many years, Maria said that her important challenge is to maintain their honesty; she enjoys her work and sharing the benefits at home with her family.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She has a food stand, where she sells different sandwiches and Pica pollo (fried chicken with potatoes or plantain) and she will buy bread, meat, plantain, cooking oil, eggs, ham and cheese, etc. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, plantains and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 3, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Mata de Palma en Desarrollo (which means: 'palm tree in development'). The group is named after the community where it is located, in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.

Carmen is a mother of four children and they live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to create her business. In the past it was very difficult, because she did not have enough money to start one up, but after she found Esperanza and took out her loans, she was able (like other members in this group) to open her business.

Carmen is excited about her thirteenth loan with Esperanza. After almost seven years in her business, she has expanded her little butcher shop into a bigger one, with more quantity of meats to supply more clients. With this loan she will increase her inventory and make even bigger sales. She will use the profits to invest in her butcher shop and she will start to save part of it to make one of her dreams come true: to start building her house. She dreams of having a nice house and a successful business with employees. Carmen and her group thank all of you for your support. 

There are three photos to complete this group of 15 members because this pictures were taken in their community and we try to make visible as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy meat such as pork, beef and bacon.

loans.name: La Honradez 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, La Honradez (The Honesty) group 5. This group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. 

She is a married mother who lives together to her husband and their three children. To earn a living, she operates miscellaneous sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, accessories, and cosmetic products. She says that her most difficult challenge was to save enough money to start her business. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending the church. 

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make one of her dreams come true: to have a successful business, with which she can be able to have a safer home and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Edith Margoth

texts.en: Edith is thirty-eight years old and has three children, aged six, nine and sixteen, who she is raising on her own. She is a strong woman who likes to do right by those around her, and she works hard harvesting potatoes and lima beans in order to provide for herself and her kids. Although her income hasn't always been steady, things have gotten better in recent years, and Edith hopes to take advantage of the upturn by investing in her crops while they are profitable. Her dream is that in a few years, if things continue the way they are, she can expand her trade to animal farming, something which would undoubtedly raise the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to harvest potatoes.

loans.name: Armonia Y Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmela, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, ellos son su razon y motivo de superación.
Desde hace tres años la Sra. Carmela se dedica a su bodega, inició éste negocio debido a que su suegra quien tenía a cargo ésta bodega fué afectada por un derrame cerebral, lo que causó que la bodega fracazara, con la motivación de su esposo y para apoyarlo en los gastos de la casa ella se dedico a levantar el negocio, poco a poco fué creciendo y aumentando sus productos, empezó solo con golosinas, luego invirtió un poco en abarrotes, luego en bebidas y ahora quiere invertir el prestamo recibido en la compra de perfumes y asi surtir un poco mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is 41 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are adults.  They are her reason and motivation to do well in life.

Carmela has been running a small store for three years.  She started this business because her mother-in-law, who previously ran the store, suffered a brain hemorrhage which caused the store to fail.  With her husband's encouragement, and in order to support him with their household expenses, Carmela started work building the business back up.  She gradually grew the business and increased the variety of products she sold.  She started out only selling candies then invested a little in groceries, then in drinks.  Now she would like to invest her loan in buying perfumes so that she can stock the business a little further.

loans.use: to invest in buying perfumes for her store

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 24-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and lives with his wife and one child who is still attending school. He’s the one responsible for covering his family expenses and paying his child’s educational fees.  He has been working in the construction field for the past five years.  He’s expert in this domain and has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction tools. This loan will facilitate his business operations and augment his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own construction office and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and four siblings. He cooperates with his father in order to satisfy their family needs. Shadi has owned a clothing shop since 2008 and has his own loyal customers. Today, he’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new clothes collection for his shop. He notes that this loan will certainly push him to get higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches of his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new clothes collection for his shop

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. He is the main source of income in the family and works hard to provide a better future for his children. 

Abdallah started his own metal and construction equipment trade business in 2008. He is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase metal supplies and construction tools for his shop. He believes that this loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to expand his business in order to earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and construction tools for his shop.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en: Rida is a 22-year-old man. He’s Lebanese, single, living with his parents and two siblings; one of them is working. He strives to work hard with the cooperation of his father, in order to fulfill their family demands.  He has six years of experience in the construction field and works on a free-lance basis. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new Bobcat and a truck for his work. This loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him to carry on his job properly. In the future, he plans to buy new and full-options equipment and take bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a new Bobcat and a truck for his work.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 26-year-old Lebanese engaged man who lives with his parents and two working siblings. After finding it hard to cover his family expenses, he decided to double his efforts and combine forces with his brother. 

Youssef started his own work as a painter in 2006, on a free-lance basis. He’s a reputable man, known for his good and well organized work. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan for his business.  This Kiva loan will facilitate his transportation, especially when visiting his customers at home. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his business

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and only one sibling who is still studying. His father is working really hard to offer a suitable life for his family. 

Abbas opened his own gadgets and balloon shop in 2009. Today, he’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials for his business such as helium, balloons and many other accessories, in order to diversify his items, boost his sales and gain a new range of customers. This will surely increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business such as helium, balloons and many other accessories.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 1 child, who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws). She has a business of selling bunches of green bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  

Lydia has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms.

She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 28 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her jobless mother. Anna graduated from the Ijevan branch of Yerevan State University where she has acquired a profession of philologist. 

Because Anna’s father is dead, she was forced to keep her family with herself. Therefore she has two occupations. She works as a secretary in one of Ijevan’s organizations, and she also runs her own business. She sells clothes directly from her house. This fact allows her to save on stall rent. Every month she buys merchandise from wholesale markets in Yerevan. Anna makes an emphasis on children's clothes, as she says that those goods are always in popular demand. She has a lot of regular customers, and she knows their tastes very well, so she tries to buy merchandise according to their requirements.
  
Her business allows her to keep her small family, and she intends to develop her trading. She needs a 500,000 AMD loan to buy various spring clothes, house slippers, baby sets, etc. to resell. This is Anna's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy various spring clothes, house slippers, baby sets, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 56 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 11 a 30 años. Desde hace 5 años, cuando estaba pasando una situación económica muy difícil, después de haber trabajado como albañil y no encontraba como ejercer este oficio,   consultó a su esposa el hacer un primer ejercicio de producir chancletas para venderlas y generar ingresos, ella apoyó esta idea y por eso Pedro prestó dinero a un amigo, compró materias primas y elaboró  unas pocas sandalias que le generaron  ingresos básicos;   a sus clientes le gustaron y empezaron a recomendarlo, por eso su clientela empezó a crecer, mientras él observando  los pies de quien pasaba por su lado todo el que veía,  agregaba el modelo observado a sus diseños. Con el apoyo de su cónyuge, y especialmente el financiamiento  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logró aumentar su capital de trabajo, crecer y estabilizarse;  con esta organización ha  recibido 2 financiamientos, durante 3 años que le han ayudado. Hoy quiere crecer aun más y está solicitando un credikiva para comprar materias primas e insumos y fabricar modelos, comprando en mayor volumen espumas láminas de suelas, pegantes forros, tacones etc. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local comercial donde exhibir sus productos, comprar maquinarias más especializadas con los que hacer efectiva su producción y continuar mejorando el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: 56-year-old Pedro lives with his wife and has six children who are between 11 and 30 years of age.  Five years ago, Pedro was experiencing a very difficult financial situation.  He worked as a builder but was not finding work.  He discussed with his wife the idea of making thongs (flip-flops) to sell and thereby make money.  She supported this idea and so Pedro borrowed money from a friend, bought raw materials and made a few pairs of sandals which made him a small amount of money.  His customers liked his products and started to recommend him.  His customer base started to grow and he looked closely at the feet of people as they passed by, adding ideas to his designs.  With the support of his wife and especially thanks to his loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Pedro managed to increase his working capital, grow his business and stabilize it.  He has received two loans from this organization who have helped him for three years.  Pedro would like to grow his business even further and is requesting a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies so that he can make his products.  He will buy foam, soles, adhesive, lining, heels etc.  His goal for the future is to have sales premises where he can display his products.  He would also like to buy more specialized machinery, which would make his production more efficient, and continue improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for making his products.  He will buy foam, soles, adhesive, lining, heels, etc.

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina” San José Obrero “están en el Primer Ciclo   con 15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.  Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Shirley vende cosméticos, en lo cual le va muy bien, pues siempre tiene buena calidad a un bajo costo. Comenta que empezó con unas pocos clientes, pero que después, gracias a su habilidad para las ventas ha podido progresar y salir adelante. Su meta es seguir con su negocio, pero crecer y seguir ayudando a sus familiares.
Quiere comprar más cosméticos, y es por ello que solicita el crédito a kiva y fundación paraguaya, para poder surtirse y tener mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is called 'San José Obrero' and its fifteen members are in their first loan cycle.  This is a group whose members stand out in their neighborhood as being very united, supportive and responsible.  They are very hard-working women who have a desire to do well and help their families.

Shirley sells cosmetics.  This is something she does very well as she always offers good-quality products at a low price.  She says that she started out with just a few customers but, thanks to her sales skills, she has been able to make progress and get ahead.  Her goal is to continue working in her business but she would like to grow the business and continue helping her family members.

Shirley would like to buy more cosmetics and she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya so that she can stock up and have a wider variety of products available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling clothing materials.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials. She also generates additional income through selling smoked fish. The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale business and to build rental rooms. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother of two children, ages 3 and 7.  She describes herself as a strong woman who works very hard to make ends meet and provide for her kids.  She learned machine sewing about five years ago, and has been doing it as a full time job ever since, making bedding and sewing pillowcases.  

She currently works alone, but with this, her first loan, she wants to buy a second sewing machine with which to increase her production, and find a helper to work with her.  Silvia's vision of the future includes purchasing many more machines and hiring more people, providing work for others and bettering her children's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 52 years old. He lives with his wife, a son and a daughter in Tsakhkunk village, in the Sevan area. He graduated from Sevan Vocational and training school, in the department of agricultural machines. He worked as a tractor mechanic for a long time. 

For more than 20 years, Harutyun and his family have been engaged in an agricultural business. With joint effort they breed four cows and some sheep. They also have a plot of land which they use as a pasture for their farm animals. They produce milk, cheese and butter which Harutyun sells at the food market and he also sells meat to butchers. 

This is Harutyun’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he always repays his loans according to repayment schedules. Now he is seeking a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a horse and also to buy fodder for his farm animals, which will simplify his sending his cows and sheep to grass.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and also a horse.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia forma parte del Banco comunal “Renaciendo al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y lencería por catalogo, desde hace 2 años. Sus ventas, las realiza a los trabajadores de un hospital, desde su casa a vecinas y conocidas. Comenta además que trabaja como asesora del hogar algunos días de la semana.
Su mercadería la compra en los barros de Patronato y Meiggs en la ciudad de Santiago. Mientras que la lencería la compra directamente en la distribuidora de la marca.
Con el crédito comprará lencería por catalogo, comenta que solo invertirá en ésta mercadería, ya que debido al cambio de temporada es más riesgoso comprar, ya que se puede quedar con mercadería sin vender.
Comenta que durante la temporada de invierno compra chalecos, calzas y ropa de polar (tela abrigadora).
Una de sus metas es instalarse con un local establecido, para esto debe ampliar su casa y concretará sus proyecciones.
Elodia vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es vacacionar y recorrer algún sector del país. Comenta que el único obstaculizador es el horario. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy bueno y unido. Está tan motivada que las reuniones las realizan en su propia casa, desde hace 6 meses. Respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido nuevas estrategias para organizar su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Elodia is a member of the 'Renaciendo al Futuro' community bank which is located in the city of Talca.  Her business is selling new clothing and catalog lingerie.  She has been in this business for two years.  She makes her sales to workers in a hospital and from her home to neighbors and acquaintances.  She says that she also works as a domestic employee some days of the week.  She buys the clothing in Patronato and Meiggs neighborhoods, in the city of Santiago and buys the lingerie directly from the brand's distributor.

Elodia will use her loan to buy catalog lingerie.  She says that she will only invest in this merchandise because, owing to the change in the season, it is more risky to buy clothing because you can end up left with merchandise which you are unable to sell.

Elodia says that during the winter season she buys cardigans, leggings and fleece clothing (a warm material).  One of her goals is to have established sales premises.  For this, she will need to extend her house and she will do it.  Elodia lives together with her husband and one of her personal dreams is to go on vacation and travel around another area of the country.  She says that the only thing stopping her is her work schedule.

Elodia is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Fondo Esperanza as it allows her to invest in her business.  She says that her community bank is very good and united.  She is so keen that she has been holding the meetings in her own home for the past six months.  As regards the training sessions, she has learned new strategies for organizing her business.

Talca is located in Maule region, in the central area of our country.  It is the region's administrative, financial and cultural center, being one of the most important cities in Chile's Central Valley.  There is an interesting reference to Talca in the Chilean phrase: "Talca, París y Londres" (Talca, Paris and London).  One of the suggestions as to its origins is that it comes from something an Englishman once said: "Talca parece Londres' (Talca is like London), owing to the abundant fog which frequently covers the city during the winter, just as it does in the UK capital.

loans.use: to buy catalog lingerie

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 19-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband who serves in the Lebanese army in order to be able to fulfill their needs. 

Malak started to work as a hairdresser and beautician in 2010. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and elegant style. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate her salon’s decoration. She notes that this will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop her business.

loans.use: to renovate her salon’s decoration

loans.name: Mariame

texts.en:
Mariame is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are still studying. She cooperates with her husband in order to offer a respectable life for their children and cover their educational fees as well. 

Mariame’s husband has his own work since 2003. As for her, she has owned a lingerie and clothing shop since 2005. Today, she’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change her shop’s interior design. She wishes to enlarge her shop by adding new clothes, and this Kiva loan will allow her achieve her goals. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to change her shop’s interior design

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with only one parent and four working siblings. His mother is the one taking care of her family and covering their expenses. 

Wael has owned a coffee shop in his town since 2009. People also meet at his place to enjoy spending time with friends. Today, he’s seeking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his shop and buy a new espresso machine as well. This will surely increase his sales and allow him to attract added customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and increase his revenue.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop and buy a new espresso machine as well

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and two siblings. His father is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. 

Unlike others of his age, Kassem started to work very early, expecting to help his father with their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2004 on a free-lance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. Today, he’s in need to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business. He notes that he’s hoping to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and only one sibling. His father is trying his best to be able to cover his family's expenses. 

As for Hasan, he’s a wholesaler who has been working selling mobile phone accessories for the past 3 years. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his minivan. In that way, he will be able to carry on his work and therefore respond to his client’s demands. In the future, Hasan plans to open his own mobile phone accessories shop.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his minivan

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en: Maroun is a thirty-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy life costs. Maroun has been working as a furniture-painter for the past four years and has already ten years of experience in this domain. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and develop his business. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and develop his business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her only parent and a working sibling. In addition to her brother, their main source of income, she also works hard to bring added income to the family. She has owned an accessories, bags and perfumes shop in her town since 2009, where all the ladies can benefit from her products. Today, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to add extra items to her existing ones, such as perfumes, bags and many other things. She notes that this will return big profits. In the future, she plans to add clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to add extra items to her existing ones, such as perfumes, bags and many other things.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of one. She sells clothes and started the business from her own savings. 

Catherine learnt of Milango from her friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. 

The extra income from this business will help Catherine pay her daughter’s school fees. She looks forward to owning a boutique in future. Her main challenge is some clients not paying on time and the difficulty in finding customers in the off-season.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Isabella owns a grocery store which has been in operation for five years. She started it off using a loan from her husband.

Isabella is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more grocery stock e.g. tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, etc. Her main challenges are delays in payment from some of her customers. She desires to purchase a plot of land to build her own house on in future.

The extra income from this loan will help her pay her children’s school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock, e.g. tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a poultry farmer who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been running for half a year. Wilfred is also married and has two children.

Wilfred is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase poultry and chicken feed. He looks forward to being a major supplier of poultry meat and eggs to the growing population of Changamwe. The challenge facing the business is the high cost of purchasing raw materials. The extra income from this loan will help Wilfred meet emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and chicken feed.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a clothes dealer, a business which has been in operation for one year. She started off with small savings from her salary.

Bakari is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase additional stocks of second hand clothes. The main challenge is overall inflation which has reduced the disposable income of most clients. She aspires to own a wholesale business in future and is willing to save the additional income from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and owns a boutique which has been in operation for four years. She started off the business using her family's savings. 

She is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase handbags and jeans clothes. The challenge in the business is overall inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most clients/customers. She aspires to be an importer of clothes. The extra income from this loan will help her pay for school fees.

loans.use: To purchase handbags and jeans clothes.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Umaru. He is married, and has three children aged two, seven and ten. 

In 2000, Umaru established his cooking utensil and rubber bowls business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant and to look after his children. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Umaru has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Umaru plans to move from a stall to a shop, to open another outlet shop for his wife and take care for his children’s needs. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils and rubber bowls.

loans.name: Alhaji Mohamed

texts.en:
This is thirty-eight-year-old Alhaji Mohamed. He is married, and has three children aged four, twelve and fifteen. He has two additional dependents, a sister and her ward, who live with him. 

In 1997, Alhaji Mohamed established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant and to take care of his children. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. 

Alhaji Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Alhaji Mohamed plans to see his business grow, make more profit, and expand to other areas in town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for used clothes.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Ishmael. He is married, and has two children aged three and seven. In 2001, Ishmael established his used clothing business. He began his business to be able to meet his family’s needs. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Ishmael has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. 

In the future, Ishmael plans to expand to another market in the town, to increase his profits and have enough funds to take care of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, trabaja independientemente como chapista (car body repair) realiza todo tipo de arreglos en vehículos y cuenta con taller propio.
El crédito lo requiere para  un incremento de capital  para su esposa la cual se dedica a la venta de edredones, de tal forma que ella pueda comprar más edredones y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Edredones en ingles significa “bed covers”.
Cesar, es casado y tiene un hijo, viven en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Tacagua ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Cesar works independently doing car body repair work.  He does all types of vehicle repairs, and he has his own shop.

He needs the loan to increase his capital for his wife, who sells comforters.  This way she will be able to buy more comforters and satisfy her customer demand.

Cesar is married and has one child.  They live in his mother and father-in-law’s house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that he has worked with IMRO, and it is the third time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to help his wife buy comforters to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a married mother of four, is a resident of Changamwe Kenya. She runs a food stall that has been running for eight years. Grace was introduced to Milango by her friends.

Grace is asking for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to pay for additional stock of foodstuffs for the food stall. Her main challenges are the seasonal business environment and high cost of raw materials. Her ambition is to open another food stall in future.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of foodstuffs for the food stall.

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This is thirty-four-year-old Idriss. He is married, and has three children aged two, five and eleven. He has an additional dependent, who live with him to help his wife with the household chores. 

In 1999, Idriss established his textiles and trimmings business. He began his business to be independent. The business started by selling trimmings and has now transformed into uniform textiles. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Idriss has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Idriss plans to expand to another market in the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for textiles and trimmings.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-erdene is thirty-eight years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two kids are school students. He started his business journey in 2003 by trading raw materials (wool, cashmere, leather). Now he expanded his business by retailing fruits, vegetables, and garments (during summer). 

Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, demand for his fruits and vegetables is high. Therefore he is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy more fruit at wholesale prices. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I try not to lose any opportunities to expand my business".

loans.use: To buy more fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola, es comerciante y tiene una tienda en al cual vende todo tipo de productos alimenticios, material escolar y de escritorio.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más productos para diversificar su tienda y obtener más ingresos para su familia.
Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia  en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Fabiola has a store where she sells all types of food products and school and desk supplies.

She needs the loan to buy more products in order to diversify her store and get more income for her family.

She is married and has two children.  They live in their own house in the Temblderani area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy various products in order to keep her store well-stocked.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Changamwe, Kenya and operates a fresh vegetable stall. This business has been in operation for one year. He is married and has one child. After being introduced to Milango by his friends, Paul is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of cabbages, onions and potatoes.

Paul looks forward to being a major supplier of vegetables in future and believes the additional income from this loan will help pay his child’s school fees and start a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cabbages, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Margaret. She is married, and has three children aged two, six and ten. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she is helping a late brother with his children’s education. 

In 1994, Margaret established her textiles business. She began her business with help from her elder sister who has relocated to another town, and with the aim of being able to cater for the needs of her family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to increase her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Margaret plans to move from a stall to a shop. She hopes that the profit realized will help her to maintain a good home. The competition is high, but she can cope. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sell.

loans.name: Chimedsuren

texts.en:
Chimedsuren is 46 years old and lives with his wife and five kids in a "ger" (Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. His wife is a janitor in a local hospital. Their older three kids are school students and the younger two are kindergarten students. 

Chimedsuren started his driving course business in 2009. He operates with one car. Even though he's fairly new to the business, he operates at full capacity. However, his car is very old and it is very hard to drive, therefore, he needs to renew his car. He already found a car to purchase and he got a pretty good deal on the old one. He's requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy the new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, tiene un taller por el cual paga alquiler ya que el trabaja como cerrajero realizando todo tipo de trabajos en cerrajería.
El  cliente vive en casa propia y crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un taller,  de esta forma ya no pagar alquileres.
Esteban es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Esteben has a shop that he rents.  He works as a locksmith, and he does all types of locksmith work.

He needs the loan to build a shop so that he does not have to pay rent.

Esteben is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room in his house to be used as a shop for his locksmith business.

loans.name: Maria Del Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres y se dedica a la confeccion de faldas, trajes, uniformes y blusas. Esta solicitando lps 3,000.00 para compras de telas, hilos para confeccionar prendas para vestir femenino.
Su deseo es seguir capacitándose en la confección de ropa para varon para de esta forma aumentar la oferta de su negocio y ampliar el mercado que sera capaz de atender en el futuro.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is single and lives in her parent's house.  She works sewing skirts, dresses, uniforms, and blouses.  

She is asking for 3,000 lps to purchase fabric and thread to make women's clothing.  Her dream is to continue learning how to sew men's clothing so that she can increase the offerings of her business and expand the market she will be able to serve in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old James.  He is married and has three children aged 3, 7 and 14. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help with the household chores.  

In 2003, James established his mobile phone accessories business. He began his business with the sale of belts and jeans but now sells mobile phone accessories, to cater for his family's needs. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

James has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to improve his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.

 In the future, James plans to develop his business and move to a shop instead of a stall and to improve the livelihood of his family. He is honest. He travels to Conakry by vehicle monthly.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Bertha Rosa

texts.es:
Bertha reside en el departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 48 años, tiene aproximadamente 7 años de tener su negocio de verduras ubicado en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Actualmente está necesitando realizar compras para abastecer su tramo debido a que la competencia es grande y la demanda debe ser satisfecha a lo inmediato.
 
Visita Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo crédito e invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de naranja dulce, agria, limón agrio, mandarina, aguacate, tomate, zanahoria, chiltoma y remolacha. Considera que este financiamiento le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in the department of Masaya. She is 48 years old and for approximately 7 years has had a vegetable business located in the municipal market of Masaya. Right now she is doing purchases to stock her business, since the competition is strong and the demand must be filled immediately.
 
She visited Ceprodel to ask for a new loan and invest it in her business, buying sweet oranges, sour oranges, lemons, tangerines, avocados, tomatoes, carrots, chiltoma peppers and beets. She thinks that this loan will help her improve her sales and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet oranges and sour oranges, lemons, tangerines, avocados, tomatoes, carrots, chiltoma peppers and beets

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Sadiatu.  She is married and has three children aged 2, 5 and 12. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help with the household chores.  

In 2005, Sadiatu established her textiles, mobile phones and accessories business. She began her business in order to be self-reliant. She started selling provisions and now sells textiles and mobile phones. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Sadiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to expand her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Sadiatu plans to improve the new shop and increase the stock; the loan can help in achieving this. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for African dresses and mobile accessories

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr José es de la ciudad de Caacupé, está casado con la  Sra Virginia. El se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un pequeño tambo lechero.
José es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas y que  siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder darle lo que necesitan su familia.
solicíta a la Fundacion y Kiva un crédito para mandar arreglar su alambrado para cargar mas animales a su tambo, agradece el apoyo recibido y espera seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo para poder crecer en su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
José is from the city of Caacupé.  He is married to Virginia.  He works as a farmer and also has a small dairy.

José is a self-sacrificing and hard-working person.  He told us that he starts work every day very early in the morning and he always makes the maximum effort so he can give his family what they need.

He requested a loan from the Foundation and Kiva to fix his fence so that he can have more animals at his dairy.  He is thankful for the support and hopes to continue working for a long time to grow in their home environment.

loans.use: to fix a link fence.

loans.name: Mujeres Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Artesanas es el grupo formado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupe. Se encuentran actualmente en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. El objetivo de ellas es trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rocio, quien está casada y tiene un hijo. Ella trabaja en la artesanía en flores, haciendo adornos y otro tipo de adornos. Este trabajo le ayuda a llevar junto con su marido los gastos de la casa. Rocio, como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva.
Rocio solicita el crédito, para la compra de flores, con lo que podrá cumplir con pedidos que tienes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Artesanas is a group made up of 12 women in the city of Caacupe. Right now it is in its sixth cycle in the Enterprising Women program of the Fundación Paraguaya. Their objective is to work together and via their work help one another. 

The president of the committee is Rocio, who is married and has a son. She works in floral artisanal crafts, making decorations and more. This job helps her to pay household expenses with her husband. Rocio and the other members are very satisfied with the financial support that is being offered to them by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

Rocio is asking for the loan to buy flowers in order to fill some orders she has.

loans.use: to buy flowers for decorations.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé  de 57 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse et a 03 enfants. Kokou travaille comme revendeur de friperies depuis 2000. Il vend seul à ses clients de façon ambulante et achète les marchandises au marché de Hedzranawoe. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le fait de se promener pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies (chemises, pantalons et autres).
Il veut avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kokou is a 57 year old man. He is married to a reseller and has three children. Kokou has worked as a reseller of second-hand clothing since 2000. He sells by himself to his customers as traveling salesman and buys his merchandise at the Hedzranawoe market. At the moment, his biggest difficulty is that he walks around in order to respond to his customers' needs.
Kokou requested his first loan with WAGES in order to buy second-hand clothing (shirts, pants, and others).
He wants to have a store to better set up shop and respond to the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
El  Sr. Lisandro es de la ciudad de Santaní,  tiene 27 años de edad, es  soltero.  Tiene una carpintería en su casa, donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día hasta muy tarde.
Lisandro comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su madre, que ya es muy mayor,  y también al resto de su familia con los gastos que surgen día a día. Su propósito es poder crecer y de esa forma seguir ayudando en su casa. Quiere poder agrandar su taller y de esa forma poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, lo cual es el principal material de su trabajo, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría podre cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Lisandro is from the city of Santani.  He is 27 years old and single.  He has a carpentry shop in his house where he works every day from early in the morning until late in the day.

Lisandro commented that his work helps his mother, who is very old, and also the rest of his family with daily expenses.  His plan is to be able to grow so that he can continue helping his family.  He wants to be able to enlarge his workshop and be able to offer work to other people.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase wood, which is the main material of his work, since he has many orders and he wants to fulfill them.  He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving that will allow him to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase wood to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.fr:
Mawulé est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse et a 09 enfants.
Mawulé travaille comme revendeur de glaçons  depuis 2011. Il vend seul ses glaçons dans une maison.
Mawulé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un congélateur. il veut  ajouter d'autres activités pour assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawulé is a 49 year old man. He is married to a reseller and has nine children.
Mawulé has worked as an ice cube salesman since 2011. He sells ice cubes by himself in a house.
Mawulé asked for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy a freezer. He wants to add on other business activities in order to ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire.
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2011. Elle vend seule à la devanture de sa maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Ayoko a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Son ambition est d’avoir une boutique et aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a freight broker. 
Ayoko has worked selling grocery items since 2011. She sells alone at the storefront at her house and stocks up in Lome. 
Ayoko asked for her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise to better respond to her customers' demands. Her ambition is to have a store and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Saran, a married mother of two children aged 4 and 13. In her quest to become self-reliant and provide for her children, Saran established her provisions business in 2009. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month.

Saran is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more provisions for her business, hoping to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to move her shop from a wooden kiosk to a concrete building, build a house, and educate her children. Saran thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for food provisions

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Idalyn, a 36-year-old married mother of six children, lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. For the past eight years, she has been operating a general store that sells a variety of products.

A member of PMPC for three years, Idalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc., and in the future hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La señora Perla es de la ciudad de Santaní, es casada, tiene hijos y comenta que su esposo es chofer de colectivo con buen ingreso mensual.
La señora es propietaria de una Despensa y peluquería, con local propio. Empezó con una pequeña casilla copetín y su peluquería en un salón, y siempre soñaba con poder tener un local más amplio para poder surtir su despensa y equipar su peluquería y así obtener más clientes y brindarle una buena atención a cada uno de ellos. Actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes los que cada día le motiva para seguir luchando para salir adelante. Es una señora muy honesta trabajadora humilde y por sobre todo muy responsable.
 Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Perla is from the city of Santani.  She is married and has children.  Her husband is a bus driver with a good monthly income.  

She is the proprietor of a general store and hair salon with its own premises.  She started with a small fast food counter and her hairdressing in a salon and always dreamed of being able to have a larger location so that she could stock her general store and expand her hair salon to serve more customers and give better service to each one of them.  She currently has many customers, which motivates her to continue fighting to get ahead.  She is a very honest, hard-working, and humble woman, and above all, is very responsible.

She is asking for help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to purchase food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other items necessary to stock her store so that she can continue offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, trabaja  todo el día como empleada en un restaurante de comida.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación en la casa de sus padres para darle más comodidad a su hijita.
Ella es soltera y tiene una hija con la cual vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria works all day as an employee in a restaurant.
