She needs the loan to build a room in her parent’s house to make her little daughter more comfortable.

She is single, and she has a daughter.  They live in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room in her parent’s house to make her little daughter more comfortable.

loans.name: Galeh

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Galeh. She is married and has 4 children, ages 2, 5, 12 and 18. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 2003, Galeh established her provisions and drinks business. She began her business to be independent; she started selling by cool man and now owns a shop. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Galeh requires a loan in order to add to the business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Galeh plans to buy more freezers and a generator, to take care of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions and soft drinks

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, trabaja como chofer independiente en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo, también para comprar llantas ya que este es el único ingreso para mantener a sus hijos.
El señor vive en casa propia, es divorciado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la zona de Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rigoberto works as an independent driver in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan for maintenance of his vehicle.  He will also buy tires,  This is the only income he has to support his children.

He lives in his own house.  He is divorced.  He lives with his three children in the Alto Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires.

loans.name: Eddy Javier

texts.es:
Eddy Javier, reside en Nindirí municipio del departamento de Masaya, tiene 8 años de tener su negocio de pulpería y  su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas compuesto por sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, requiere invertir en él por medio de la compra de granos básicos y abarrotes tales como un quintal de azúcar, un quintal de arroz, un quintal de frijoles, bidón de aceite, papel higiénico, jabón súper marfil, ace en polvo, salsa de tomate.

Agradece a Ceprodel porque confía que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eddy Javier lives in the town of Nindirí in the department of Masaya.  He has had his general store for eight years and his family group is made up of four people, his two children and his wife.

Like all businesses in development, he needs to invest in it by buying basic necessities and groceries such as one "quintal" (46 kg./100 lbs.) each of sugar, rice, and beans; a can of oil; toilet paper; Súper Marfil soap; and tomato sauce.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL because he trusts that his loan will be granted satisfactorily and so he will be able to improve the state of his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, Ace detergent, Súper Marfil soap, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 49 year old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Felisa sells dried fish to her community. She has been in this kind of business for 3 years. Felisa also supports her husband's fishing. She helps sell his catch at the market. Felisa works hard to help sustain her family. She plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell. Felisa hopes for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a 43 year old married woman. She has 9 children whose ages range from 6 years to 25 years old. She describes herself to be a honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more bags of maize. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize for selling.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and is married with two children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling beauty products.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mungunsar

texts.en: Mungunsar is 57 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her leather and silver jewelry trading business in 2010 after coming from Korea. Now that her business is stable, she wants to increase her supplies since her business is the only income in the family. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she knows what her customers need. She's requesting 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "All I want is for my kids to have a stable business when I'm gone."

loans.use: to purchase more silver

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 30 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with 1 child. 

Emely has a lumber business and earns approximately 8,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to finance her lumber business. Emely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to finance her lumber business

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 2 kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband works with her. The elder kid is employed and the younger one is a college student. Her husband is a carpenter and she sells her goods (handmade chairs, tables, cupboards, etc.) in the market. Over the years she gained many customers. Her products are known for their high quality and very affordable price. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is high. Therefore, she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Since my boy joined a college, I have to work as hard as I can in order to support him."

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Sanred

texts.en:
Sanred is 39 years old and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao. He is single and has no children. Sanred works in the fishing industry and catches and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 15 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase a pump boat.

Sanred has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase a pump boat.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia (an area that lacks basic infrastructure). He supports his family by operating a clothing sale business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

His wife helps him, while their elder son attends local primary school and their cousin babysits for their daughter. Now, Byambadorj has 2.6 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital, and he usually sells men's and women's clothes and blankets. In February, Mongolians celebrate the traditional holiday Tsagaan Sar, so Byambadorj needs more clothes to sell for the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell for an upcoming traditional Mongolian holiday.

loans.name: Abgael

texts.en:
Abgael is a single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself as humble. 

Abgael operates a retail store where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents. Abgael describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of clothing materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase more clothing materials. Her goal is to expand her business and be the best dressmaker in the area within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for making dresses to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria has been farming rice for 22 years and also earns additional income from computer gaming, a general store and coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fertlizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Damon

texts.en:
Damon is a married man. He has two children, ranging in age from 1 to 2 years old. He describes himself as God-fearing. 

Damon operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, oranges, green maize, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. Damon describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits for selling. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children who range in age from 3 to 12 years old. She describes herself as an honest woman.

Isabellah operates a poultry farm and she sells broiler chickens. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of chicken food. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chicken food. Isabellah's business goal is to become a broiler wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy chicken food.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani is a 80-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 20 years to 39 years. He describes himself to be an honest and intelligent man. He operates a business where he sells charcoal.

For more than twenty years,  he has been involved in this business. His business is located at a very competitive area and his primary customers have been frequent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell and pay for the construction of a room of operation. His business goal is to be a big supplier of charcoal  within five years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and pay for the construction of a room to sell out of.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is a 39 year old married man. He has 3 children whose ages range from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be focused and creative. He operates a welding shop where he sells metal doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located at a strategic area and his primary customers are schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase metal. His business goal is to run three similar welding shops within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more metals.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 32 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Agbétomegblon

texts.fr:
Agbetomegblon est  un homme âgé de 59 ans. Il est marié å un/e tresseuse et ont ensemble 02 enfants.
Agbetomegblon travaille comme revendeur des produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2009. Il vend dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé 
Agbetomegblon a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.  Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’avoir des profits pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agbetomegblon is a 59 year old man. He is married to a braider. They have 2 children.
Agbetomegblon has been working as a grocery salesman since 2009.He works in a shop and buys his stock at Lomé.
Agbetomegblon requests his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase grocery products. He wants to reinvest in his business in order to increase his profits and offer better conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Moutcharafatou

texts.fr:
Moutcharafatou est une femme âgée de 41  ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 02 enfants, tous deux à l’école. Le premier a dix huit ans et le dernier a onze ans.
Moutcharafatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend du charbon de bois et divers pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Moutcharafatou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon et divers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Moutcharafatou voudrait augmenter la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Moutcharafatou is a 41 year old woman. She is married to a retired person. She has 2 children, both of whom go to school. The first is eighteen and the second is eleven.
Moutcharafatou has worked as a saleswoman since 2003.She sells bags of charcoal and various other products to her customers from her home. She buys her stock at Lomé. She works alone. At present her main problem is stock shortage.
Moutcharafatou requests her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase charcoal and various other products. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the next few years, Moutcharafatou would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and various products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Alma has a shop that sells makes and snacks like cassava and rice cakes. Her husband is providing motorela or motorcycle services in their community. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. 

She operates a tailor shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a less busy area and her primary customers are her frequent ones and walk-ins. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more clothes materials. Margaret's business goal is to run a tailoring school within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes materials.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Hilda has a construction-supplies shop that sells different sizes of timber and lumber. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of lumber to sell.

Hilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is aged thirty and her husband sells clothes. She has two children aged between fifteen and 5 months. The oldest child attends school. Emerthe owns a retail shop where she sells different items and she has requested the loan to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. She has been in the business for the past twelve years. With the profits she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in the boutique such sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Tumenbayar is a 43-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her younger daughter attends the Royal academy in Mongolia, while her elder daughter studies in Korea. She has been operating a grocery store business since 2010. 

Since the Mongolian national holiday Tsagaan Sar, in February, is a high sales season, Tumenbayar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store in order to increase her working capital for the traditional Mongolian holiday.  

She is very trusted, repeat client of our NBFI and this is her third time on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the national holiday of Mongolia

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be sociable and honest. She operates a retail stall where she sells items such as shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are passersby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. 

Linah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will enlarge her retail stall.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Amelita has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to buy fish for sale.
Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Maricel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of snacks, bananas & spices like pepper.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy stocks of snacks, bananas & spices

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Nick has a shop that makes & sells wood & coconut charcoal per sacks. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconut & wood needed for making charcoal.

Nick has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy coconut & wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une femme âgée de quarante ans. Elle est mariée å un staticien. Elle a deux enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a dix sept ans et le dernier a quinze ans.
Ami travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ami a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité pour augmenter son capital.
Dans les prochaines années, Ami voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ami is a forty year old woman. She is married to a statistician .She has two children, both attend school. The first is seventeen and the second fifteen years old.
Ami has worked as a saleswoman since 2001.She sells grocery products to her customers from her home. She buys her stock at Lomé. She works alone. At present her main difficulty is shortage of stock.
Ami requests her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase general grocery products. She wants to reinvest in her business to increase her capital.
In the next few years, Ami would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure a happy future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase general grocery products.

loans.name: Luciah

texts.en: Luciah is a single woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a mobile business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be harrasment from the municipal council. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more eggs for selling. Her business goal is to venture into a bigger shop within 5 years.

loans.use: purchase more eggs for selling.

loans.name: Rosemar

texts.en:
Rosemar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Rosemar is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.
Rosemar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosemar hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Daisy has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. Her husband is providing motorela or motorcycle services. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale.
Daisy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Jeneth has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jeneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jeneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
 
Christine has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells beauty products & perfumes from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Virgincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products

loans.name: Mry Claire

texts.en:
Mry Claire  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mry Claire  has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Mry Claire  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mry Claire  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Ramon has a shop that sells fruits, bananas & coconut. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of fruits, bananas & coconut to sell.

Ramon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ramon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Paz has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells curtains and school & office uniforms. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy cloth & materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 1998.  In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth & materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anesia has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Anesia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Anesia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Alice has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale and will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Alice hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a clinic. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 39 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 36 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to complete her residential house. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana, se dedica  a la venta de fruta hace ya dos años,  es una cliente que esta sacando crédito en una tercera secuencia en nuestra institución, la Sra. Juana  tiene su negocio en una zona muy comercial y populosa de  la ciudad de La Paz, vende frutas por mayor y al por menor,  a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 19:30 aproximadamente todos los días, su principal aspiración es comprarse un terreno y tener su casa propia, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas de temporada para poder vender en su negocio, la Sra. Juana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana has been selling fruit for two years now. She is a client in her third loan cycle with our institution. Juana has her business in a very commercial and populous area of the city of La Paz. She sells fruit at wholesale and retail, from 6:00am until approximately 7:30 pm every day.  

Her main goal is to buy herself a piece of land and to have her own house. With the money from the loan, she will buy seasonal fruit to sell in her business. Juana is a very hard-working person, who feels happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for buying fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a single woman. She describes herself as a honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells DVDs, compact disk and coconut. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of coconut. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more coconut, CDs and DVDs. Her business goal is to venture into a new business of hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut, dvds and compact disks for selling.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. Nova has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Nova has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Nova hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en: Conrada is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Conrada has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Conrada  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Conrada  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Roche Channel

texts.en:
Roche Channel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Roche Channel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Roche Channel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roche Channel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. Anecito is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of 13,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.
Anecito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anecito hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be courageous and decisive. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, beauty products, etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Alice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase clothing materials and beauty products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: buy clothing materials and cosmetics

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Aida makes and sells home-made ice cream using a motorcycle as carriage. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Marieto

texts.en:
Marieto is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 5 children. 

Marieto has a shop that sells coconut for copra & charcoal. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconut for charcoal & copra.

Marieto has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Marieto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy coconut for charcoal & copra

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be honest woman. 

Ruth operates a retail stall where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be health problems. 

Ruth will use the KES 15000 loan to buy more fish to sell. Her business goal is to construct a fish selling store for operation within 5 years.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Om Khalid Group

texts.en:
This group is called OM KHALID. It consists of six members:  Foziah, Ebtsam, Mdwy, Rwza, Mariem and Klthom* (she doesn`t appear in the photo) who are mainly married women and two to five children each. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hard workers. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have many clients mostly women. The whole group took a loan of 300,000 YER.

Mariem is the group leader. She is 46 years old and a widow who lives in Sana`a. (She is in the middle with her face not covered.) She has two children; the older is 32 years old and the younger is 11 years old. She has been operating a business of clothing sales for over five years. 

For the past five years she has been contributing to the family’s income by working from home, using her business. She works very hard to improve the future for her children; she is happy to work from home and is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to her customers. She achieved a part of her goal, looking after her older son since she helped her son to study till he completed his university degree and now  she wants have her daughter study in school. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB which she will use to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product.


In the future, Mariem dreams of saving money in order to open a new store to sell clothes in that will ensure she can continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials.

loans.name: Chov

texts.en:
Chov is a 36-year-old single parent who has been blessed with three single children.  She lives together with them and her husband in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province.  

Chov is in the business of raising pigs.  She also takes time to grow vegetables to uplift her standard of living. However, Chov just earns a small income from her two businesses.  Presently, two of her children help her in earning income by working in various careers in Phnom Penh city. 

Chov is taking out this loan to help her two employed children, who currently go to work by taking taxi services. Chov will use it to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for them to commute to their workplaces. For her own prospects, Chov wants to build a general store and sell merchandise.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Renacer, por ser un grupo que renació después de haberse desintegrado, ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo, trabajando siempre bajo un marco de respeto. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17 mujeres que invierten en sus actividades con el fín de alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para toda la familia.
Una de las miembros es la sra. Edid, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de toda clase, con lo cual ha logrado salir adelante y ofrecer la comodidad que necesita su familia. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder salir adelante. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Renacer’ [‘to be reborn’] because it is a group that was reborn after it broke up.  The members are committed to maintaining the unity of the group and to always working within a framework of respect.  They are currently in their fifth loan cycle and have an excellent rating.  The group is made up of 17 women who invest in their economic activities with the goal of achieving a better standard of living for their families.  

One of the members is Edid, who makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  She has managed to get ahead with her business and to offer her family the comfort that it needs.  She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who always goes the extra mile to help her family.  Her goal is to have a shop where she can provide more convenience for her customers.

Edid is asking for a loan to purchase clothing so she can stock up and thus be able to get ahead.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it is providing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 24-year-old, single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He studied up to the Bachelor's level in university. He is very hard-working and he has been operating a grocery store.

He started his business with a partner and together, they opened a small grocery. Then he collected more money and purchased the business share from his partner to have his own business. He has regular customers because he brings in fresh products. He has employed a worker who helps him in his business. 

Moath has made the decision to invest in his business by buying merchandise wholesale so that he can have the store well-stocked with a variety of products that will help him to keep his clientele and to attract new customers. So, he is requesting a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to refill his working capital and create additional shelves and displays for products.

In the future, Moath hopes to attain better living conditions in order to get married.

loans.use: to create additional shelves and displays for products for his business

loans.name: Madina Group

texts.en:
This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called "MADINA" and consists of six members: Aisha, Fatima, Aml, Gohra, Fatima and Madina. They live in Aden, Yemen and each is interested in developing her business. They requested a loan of 300,000 YER.

Madina is the group leader (she is located in the center of the group, wearing a black and yellow wrap with her face showing.) This group is called by her name. She is aged 57, married, and the mother of seven adult children. Her business is selling clothes, which has been her sole source of income for over ten years. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood.

She is very grateful to her neighbors who supported her over all these years. With the income from her business she has been able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comfort.

At the present time, her business doesn't get her a lot of profit due to the bad situation in Yemen.  So she applied for the loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. to sell to her customers thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

In the future she would like to buy a house with a store in it in order to expand her activity.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 40 years old. She lives in a small village in Kartli district, East Georgia. Nona is married and lives with her husband - Tariel, and three sons (14, 13 and 8 years old).   The children go to school.  

Nona’s husband is a worker who works mainly in construction. Nona is leading the agricultural business for the family. She runs a small dairy farm with 4 milk cows. She produces cheese and sells on average 80 kg of this product in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Laris. 

Nona requested credit to diversify the family agricultural business. She will purchase a pig and start a small pig farm. Nona will sell piglets in the village. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for purchasing hay for the cows. 

By starting up a pig farm, the income of the family will increase. Nona will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve her family's living conditions. Also she plans to reinvest part of the profit into further development of the pig farm.

loans.use: buy a pig and hay for cows

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is from a small village nearby Tbilisi. He is 22 years old, unmarried and lives with his family: mother, 21-year-old sister, and grandmother (retired).

Otar’s mother is a doctor and his sister works as an intern. Otar is leading the agricultural business for the family. They have 2 milk cows and a calf. Otar sells milk in Tbilisi. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Laris. 

Otar requested credit to purchase two calves and hay for them. He will grow the calves and after a year the family will have four milk cows. The amount of sold dairy products will double and the income for the family will increase by 40%. Otar will use the increased income for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy 2 calves and hay

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in village Tserovani, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband Ivane, two sons (25 and 18 years old), daughter-in-law and two grandsons. 

The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have 7 milk cows and 10 calves. Rosa and her daughter-in-law produce cheese and yogurt and sell them in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Rosa requested credit to purchase two milk cows. She will be able to produce more dairy products and increase the income for the family. She will use the income to purchase additional household goods, which will improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: buy two milk cows

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao is 32 and a humble resident from Kompong Cham province. She has been operating a selling business located in her house. She sells many types of merchandise as well as groceries to local people. From this business, she is able to earn $5.00 per day. Kao has a very big family with 12 children. 

Kao would like to acquire some funds from HKL to purchase a stock of merchandise for a constant sale. Since the loan helps sustain her business, Kao hopes that she’ll be able to further improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise for constant sale.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong sells used clothes from a rented booth near a local market in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 63 and a single mother of eight children, six of whom are already married. In parallel, two of her daughters are in the same business as her in different marketplaces to help uplift this family out of poverty. 

With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will purchase a stock of used clothes to further improve her current business. Without any other help, Mong’s family will meet difficulties in living. She is very thankful for the quick response from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes to further improve her current business.

loans.name: Tavga's Group

texts.en:
Tavga is 21 years old, a young Iraqi wife. For the last two years, she has been working from home on an old sewing machine to contribute to her family's income and participate in the creation of her new home and life shared with her husband. 

Tavga took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine with a table and chair for her home work area.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a table and chair for her work area

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 46 years old. He is from a small village near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. He lives with his family: wife – Iza, 16-year-old daughter and 14-year-old son.  The children go to school. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows.  Iza produces yogurt and sells it locally. Also, the family owns a greenhouse where cucumbers, potatoes and greens are grown. Mamuka sells the harvested vegetables in Tbilisi. The total average monthly income for the family is 700 Laris. 

Mamuka requested credit for renovation of the greenhouse. He will change the broken glasses as well as purchase gas for heating the greenhouse, otherwise it won’t keep the needed temperature and the family will lose the most important source of their income. After the renovation, the family can count on a good harvest, which will be sold for convenient prices and bring more income. Mamuka plans to use it to finance his family's daily needs.

loans.use: renovate his greenhouse

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is from the village of Asureti in West Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her family: husband - Merab and 18-year-old son.  Her son is a student. 

Nato works as a baby-sitter in the village. Merab is a worker, he works on house renovations. Along with their main jobs, Nato and Merab are busy with the family's dairy farm. They have 2 milk cows. Nato produces cheese and Merab sells on average 40 kg of this product per month in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris. 

Nato requested credit to expand her existing cattle shed. In the nearest future, she plans to increase the amount of cows in the family's dairy farm, but the existing shed is too small for additional cows. When the family has more cows, they will increase the production and sales of cheese and get more income. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: expand her cattle shed

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from a small village near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. She is 43 years old and lives with her family: husband – Konstantin, 21-year-old daughter, 19-year-old son, son-in-law, and 75-year-old mother. 

Nino is leading the agricultural business for her family.  She has a milk cow.   Nino produces yogurt and sells it locally. Also, the family owns a greenhouse with an area of 250 sq. meters.  It is used for growing tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. Nino sells the harvested products in Tbilisi. Nino’s husband is a worker. The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris, including the monthly pension of Nino’s mother. 

Nino requested credit to purchase a new milk cow. She will double the production and sales of yogurt and the income of the family will increase. Nino will use increased income to purchase additional household goods to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Myriam Maritza

texts.es: Myriam compró aceite, sal, arroz y productos de aseo que vendió a sus clientes muy rápidamente y luego volvió a invertir y esto es gracias a su primer credikiva, con el que quedó muy satisfecha; ahora planea aplicar a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen estas mismas mercancías así estaría una vez mas dando crecimiento a su capital de trabajo. Ella envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias, muchísimas gracias por el apoyo que me están dando, son una bendición de Dios gracias a ustedes sigo adelante con mi tiendecita, espero que sigan ayudándonos a mi y a otras personas que lo necesitamos, para que podamos seguir adelante. Que Dios los bendiga. “
texts.en:
Myriam bought cooking oil, salt, rice, and hygiene products, which she sold to her customers very quickly. She then invested again, thanks to her first credikiva, which she was very satisfied with. 

Now she plans to apply for a new credikiva, with which she will buy the same merchandise in greater volume. This way, she will be increasing her working capital once more.

She sends a message to the Kiva lenders, "Thank you, thank you very much for the support you are giving me. You are a blessing from God. Thanks to you, I keep going with my little store, and I hope you keep helping me and other people who need it, so that we can get ahead. May God bless you."

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, salt, rice, and hygiene products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María tiene 38 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene  10 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de carne de llama y cordero que se encuentran en mercado muy concurrido de la zona, esta en quinta secuencia de su  préstamo con muestras institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de carne de llama y cordero  para surtir su negocio, por esta razón solicita este préstamo es para incremento de capital por las fiestas de carnavales. La Sra. María se enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ampliación de negocio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de materiales de construcción para hacer terminar su casita, sueña con  ampliar su negocio con la apertura de un nuevo local y así generar mas ingresos, la Sra. María es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María is 38, married, and has a 10-year-old son. She sells llama and lamb meat in a very busy local market. This is her fifth loan cycle with our institution. Maria is going to use this loan to buy llama and lamb meat to supply her business. This is the reason she is applying for a loan, in order to increase her working capital for the carnival festivities. 

Maria faces challenges in her business, including the expansion of her business. She is going to use the profits to buy construction materials to have her small house completed. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a new shop, and generating more income this way. Maria is a very enterprising and hard-working person. She feels happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy llama and lamb meat.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de que algunas de las miembros ya estaban dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad, ya que les gusta trabajar en grupo, y ser emprendedoras.  De esa manera formaron su comité y se inicia dicho grupo. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa, y su meta es poder trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra Lilian tiene 31 años de edad, está casada con el Sr  Silvino quien es pintor de obras,  juntos tienen 2 hijos, quienes son la razón de lucha de ambos. La Sra Lilian  es vendedora de frutas y verduras de estación. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos que diariamente aparecen y de esa forma hacer más ligera la carga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que le da fundación paraguaya de poder crecer y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The above group was formed when some of the women who were already in the Women’s Program decided to form a group within their community because they enjoy working in a group with other businesswomen. The group is in its first loan cycle; the women's goal is to work together and help each other.

Sra. Lilian is 31 years old and married to Sr. Silvino who is a painter. They have two children, giving them a reason to work hard. Lilian sells fruit and seasonal vegetables. Because of this job she has been able to help her husband with the expenses that occur daily and in this way lighten his responsibilities.

Lilian is seeking a loan to buy fruit and vegetables so she has more stock and a greater variety of produce to offer to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by the Paraguay Foundation to grow her business and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Evelia Margarita

texts.es: Evelia es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad. Con su gran experiencia como promotora de productos alimenticios de consumo masivo, debió dejar de trabajar en empresas porque su capacidad física quedó disminuida, pero ella,  una mujer persistente y emprendedora, puso entonces un gran empeño en apoyar a su familia mediante una actividad comercial, en la cual se desempeñara autónomamente, fue así como se dedicó a la venta de productos mediante guías especializada o catálogos. En su negocio vende ropa femenina y mercancías variadas, pero debe pagar su pedido,  desde el mismo momento en el que lo recibe y muchas veces su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para financiarles la cartera a nuevos clientes, quienes usualmente compran a crédito, en plazos hasta de 3 meses. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, cosméticos perfumes etc, para responderle a pedidos de sus clientes, con este financiamiento espera aumentar el número de sus clientes y fortalecer su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, vendiendo con precios de oferta que fidelizan clientes.
texts.en:
Evelia is married and has a 30-year old son. Despite her wide experience as a promotor of nutritional food, she had to stop this line of work because of ill-health. However, because she is a hardworking and determined woman, she made the effort to support her family through a different commercial activity selling products from specialised guides or catalogs. She sells women’s clothing and a variety of other merchandise. 

Evelia’s problem is that she has to pay for the goods at the moment of receiving them, and often she cannot afford to do this for new customers who usually buy on credit with a repayment period of up to three months. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfume etc. so she can fulfill her customers’ orders. With this loan she hopes to increase her customer base and her ability to carry credit on behalf of her customers. She plans to cultivate customer loyalty by offering specials.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfume etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 6 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay half of her children's school fees. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a motorcycle. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader de 31 años de edad es casado, labora para ENACAL como fontanero desde hace mas de 11 años. Esta solicitando su  9no credito con el objetivo de terminar de pagar su casita la cual le habian dado en pago y  mejorarla, ya que necesita que sus hijos cuenten con mayor comodidad, pues el mayor que tiene 7 años ya esta cursando el 2do grado de primaria y necesita hacer su propio espacio para desarrollarse mejor.  El mayor sueño de Jader es poder brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor y que estos estudien para que sean hombres de provecho y orgullo de la sociedad.
texts.en:
31-year old Jader is married and has worked for ENACAL as a plumber for 11 years. He is seeking his ninth loan so he can finish paying for the renovations he’s doing on his house. He wants a more comfortable home for his children. The older one is 7 years old and is in grade 2. He needs his own room so he can develop appropriately.

Jader’s dream is to be able to provide his children with the best life possible. He wants them to study hard so that they become good men that he can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is from Kompong Cham province, a place where the land is very fertile for our farmer growing her crops within the two growing seasons of the year. There are many different types of crops such as rice, corn, potatoes, cashew trees and vegetables. 

Huong, age 51, has been in this type of business for many years. Agriculture is the main source of her income. She now is a good mother of four children; two are married, and two are single. But in the next few weeks, Huong will celebrate a wedding party for her third child. That’s why Huong would like to request this loan to use in the wedding preparations, which will happen soon. She would like to say thanks to all of our generous lenders, who help her family as well as others.

loans.use: to use in the wedding preparations.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is an old woman of the age of 72. She has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a single parent for a few years with five children. She has been engaged in the agricultural business as a local rice farmer for more than 30 years. Besides generating income from rice, Pheng, together with her son, is involved in trading corn, which she buys in bulk from local villagers. 

She is asking for a loan from Kiva through HKL to supplement her existing capital to purchase stock of corn for trading. She hopes her business will further grow through using this loan.

loans.use: to supplement her existing capital to purchase stock of corn for trading.

loans.name: Airk

texts.en:
Airk is 60 years old. She is a resident of Baray district, Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Airk has been blessed with five children, two of whom are married, while the rest are single. Airk is in two businesses: rice cultivating and fish selling. She is operating a fresh-fish selling business in her neighborhood.

To prepare her soil for growing dry-season rice this year, Airk is looking for her second loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase a cow and 10 sacks of fertilizer to put in her soil to keep it in good condition. With great help from our lenders, Airk hopes that she’ll be able to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and 10 sacks of fertilizer to put in her soil.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita actualmente vive por la zona del Las Pampitas, La señora tiene  un local de entretenimiento  donde tiene juegos y rokola, mesas de billar y a la ves ofrece refrescos y cervezas se dedica  a esta  actividad hace ya 2 años,  La señora Benita vive con su hija, también  cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes,  solicita el crédito para mantenimiento de Rokola y el saldo para la compra de refrescos Y heladera,  La solicitante lleva viviendo en el lugar hace mas de diez años. Cuenta con muy buenos ingresos y patrimonio que la respaldan. La Sra. Benita es una persona muy trabajadora,  su deseo es el ver a su hija profesional, ya que por este sueño trabaja mucho agradeció por la oportunidad que le esta brindando y al mismo tiempo agradeció por la rapidez con la que se la atendió.
texts.en:
Benita lives in the Las Pampitas neighborhood.  She runs an entertainment center where she has games, a Rockola jukebox, and pool tables, and also sells soft drinks and beer.  She has had this business for 2 years.  Benita lives with her daughter, and also has a grocery store.  She is requesting this loan so she can perform maintenance on the jukebox and have enough left over to purchase soft drinks and a refrigerator.
  
Benita has lived in the same place for more than ten years.  She has a very good income and assets to support her.  She is a very hardworking woman, and she wants to see her daughter become a professional, which has been her dream.  She is really grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and appreciates that the loan arrangements have been made so quickly.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her Rockola jukebox and to purchase soft drinks and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is a 63-year-old married woman who permanently lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She lives there together with her husband and four children, three of whom have their own independent living. Besides rice husbandry, a main business of her family, Seng raises some piglets in a wooden pigpen in her backyard for additional income. 

At the present, Seng would like to request a loan from Kiva through HKL to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farmland. Through using the loan given, Seng hopes she’ll be able to expand her business and thereby better her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farmland.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luis nacido  La localidad de El Torno, actualmente vive y tiene su parcela en la localidad de 22 de Agosto a 55 km de la localidad de Limoncito hacia el sur,  el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, sorgo, sandia, y también se dedica a la producción del carbón, todo lo que el siembra lo saca a vender al mercado de la zona,  ya viene trabajando con emprender hace tres créditos, por  que es la única institución que le ha brindado un apoyo para mejorar su calidad  de vida, por lo cual el cliente manifiesta que esta muy agradecido con la institución ya que con este dinero del crédito comprar semillas para la siembra de maíz y una motosierra par la fabricación de carbón.
texts.en: Luis was born in El Torno but currently lives and owns land in the town of "22 de Agosto" which is 55 kilometers south of the town of Limoncito.  He is a farmer who grows corn, sorghum and watermelon, and he also produces charcoal.  He sells everything he grows at the local market.  He has received three loans from Emprender, since it is the only institution that has given him support to improve his lifestyle.  He is very grateful to the institution and will use this loan to buy seeds to plant corn and a chain saw to make charcoal.

loans.use: To buy a chain saw and seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 42 años de edad y vive en Arjona, un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 10 años respectivamente; para generar el sustento de su familia el emprendió su propio negocio,  a través del cual vende al detalle ranchos, víveres, refrescos, abarrotes, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa y vecinos del sector, a quienes les vende de contado y diariamente,  todo lo relacionado al consumo alimentario principalmente. Juan desde hace muchos años, emprendió este negocio inicialmente con plátano, ñame y aguacate, gradualmente empezó a agregarle otros productos y hoy además ofrece el servicio de transporte  en el pueblo,  a través de un vehículo llamado Moto-Taxi. En sus negocios le ha ido muy bien pero tiene el gran propósito de crecer y para ello requiere capital de trabajo, con el cual invertirle y ofrecer productos que compraría por volumen y con descuentos que abaratan sus costos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará carne, queso, arroz, aceite, café, pollo granos, azúcar etc. Su meta es capitalizar su negocio de tienda y agregar cada vez más productos variados que piden sus clientes y con los que aun no cuenta en su exhibición; su gran desafió es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives in Arjona, a municipality of the Bolivar Department, with his wife and 2 children, 7 and 10. To support his family, he started his own business selling food, groceries, refreshments and other everyday products. His principal customers are housewives and neighbors to whom he sells groceries every day. Many years ago, Juan started this job selling bananas, yams and avocado and then began adding other products. He also offers transportation in his town with his Moto-Taxi. His business has done very well, but he’d like to expand and grow, and to do that, he needs capital. He’d invest in buying more products by volume in order to lower his costs. This is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan – his 1st with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan he will buy meat, cheese, oil, coffee, chicken, grains, sugar, etc.
His goal is to invest in his retail business by adding more and more varied products that his customers ask for and that he doesn’t have.
His biggest challenge is to obtain enough capital to achieve his purpose.

loans.use: buy meat, cheese, rice, oil, coffee, chicken, grains, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Helyn Del Socorro

texts.es: Helyn de 36 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED de Acoyapa como docente desde hace 8 años. Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de mejorar la casa familiar ubicada en la comarca San Agustin de Acoyapa, donde junto a sus padres habitan en ella, en este momento lo que desea hacer es reparar las cercas de la propiedad pues desean brindarle seguridad a la propiedad y ademas evitar que los animalitos que tienen se le vayan a las propiedades vecinas.  Hely se caracteriza por ser muy responsable con los compromisos, ademas expresa que gracias a los creditos que se le han financiado ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Helyn, 36, is single and has been working as a teacher for MINED in Acoyapa for eight years.  She is requesting her ninth loan in order to improve the family home located in the San Agustin county in Acoyapa, where she lives with her parents.  For the time being, she wants to repair the fences around the property for security reasons and to keep the small animals from going into her neighbors' yards.  Helyn is very responsible with commitments and she is grateful for the loans which have helped improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair fences.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: A Sandra con su anterior credikiva le fue bien porque compró enmayor cantidad telas e insumos de confección con los que ganó buenos descuentos e hizo nuevos diseños que vendió muy rapidamente. En la actualidad planea solicitar un nuevo credikiva para aumentar una vez mas su capital de trabajo pues desea responder a pedidos de sus clientes, que han solicitado nuevos vestuarios que ella fabricará. Con su credikiva comprara telas, hilos, aplicaciones e insumos de confección. Ella da gracias a sus finaciadores y considera que la línea Kiva es muy buena porque ofrece intereses bajos.
texts.en: Sandra used her previous loan well and was able to buy bulk fabric and sewing supplies at greater discounts and made new designs that sold quickly.  She is now requesting a new loan to increase her working capital and be able to fill customer orders for new clothes.  She will use the loan to buy fabrics, threads, appliqués and sewing supplies.  She is grateful to the lenders and feels Kiva is very good because of the low interest rates.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE  est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Célestin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Marie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Marie exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (condiments, vivres). Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un troisième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Missimide Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This group's representative, named Marie, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time this group is seeking the financial support of Alidé with the aim of increasing their business.

Marie is 41 years old and is married to a carpenter named Célestin. The couple has four children, all of them in school, two of whom remain in their care. Marie lives with her husband and children. The couple sees to the various expenses together. Marie stopped going to school during elementary school.

For the past fifteen years, Marie has run a business selling various goods (spices, food supplies). This allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. Marie obtains her supplies at a market in Benin. In the hope of better responding to customer demand, Marie would like to build up her product stock and enhance her business activity. In order to do so, Marie, along with the other members of the Missimide Group, is seeking a third loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase spices and food supplies.

loans.name: Angela Ines

texts.es: La señora Ángela se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrónicos como por ejemplo: televisores, equipos de sonido, y otros que le soliciten, estas ventas las realiza en la ciudad de El Alto  Bolivia, por ser esta una ciudad en desarrollo, las compras las realiza en otro País  donde viaja cada tres meses ha proveerse de mercadería a un precio mas bajo por ser este un país que cuenta con puertos marítimos,  los precios de estos productos son mas bajos por este motivo solicito el  crédito para la compra de televisores, su conyugue es el que le colabora en esta actividad, la familia cuenta con un hijo de 2 años de edad el cual les motiva a seguir adelante con su negocio esperando algún día poder brindarle una buena educación y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ángela sells electrical appliances such as televisions, sound equipment, and other things that people request.  She makes her sales in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, because this is a developing city.  She buys her merchandise in another country, and travels there every three months to stock up on merchandise at lower prices.  Since this country has sea ports, the prices are lower.  She is asking for this loan to buy televisions.

Her husband works with her and they have a two year old son, who is their motivation for moving ahead with their business, in hopes that they will be able to someday provide him with a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy televisions.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a loving mother who is in the age of 44. She is married with 4 children. She lives together with her family in Dongkor commune. To make a livelihood, Sam operates a selling business. She sells mixed products to the people in her commune. She sells things like soft drinks, groceries, sweet things and biscuits. She typically earns around $7.00 per day from this business. In order to upgrade her standard of living, Sam decided to get involved in a pig-raising business. However, she won’t be able to go further on her project due to the lack of financial capital. 

And now, she would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase a few head of breeding pigs and to build a pigpen. Sam is very appreciative for the given loan to attain her dream of having a comfortable living. With the increase in income, she wants to save it to enlarge her pig-raising business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael de 51 años de edad es casado, labora para el INSS como Analista de Recuperacion  desde hace 5 años. Esta solicitando su  7mo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa terminando el porche, pues le falta repellarlo y ponerle el piso y parte del techo, pues quiso hacerlo con sus ahorros pero le fue imposible terminar su pequeño proyecto. Cabe señalar que Rafael se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable con sus compromisos y obligaciones adquiridas.
texts.en: Rafael, 51, is married and works as a Recovery Analyst for the INSS, where he has been employed for five years.  He is requesting his seventh loan in order to upgrade his house by finishing the porch, which requires dry wall, flooring and part of the roof.  He wanted to carry out this small project with his savings but was unable to do so.  It is worth mentioning that Rafael is known for being very responsible in his commitments and acquired obligations.

loans.use: To finish his porch.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin is 29 years old and a mother of 2 school-age kids. She is a local laborer who works for a factory in Prey Chor district. Her daily work is to package cashew nuts into plastic bags. She gets her payment monthly as salary. 

Phin wants to run a micro-business at home with her spare time and thereby increase her income. She intends to buy a few heads of piglets, pig feed and to build a pigpen. As a result, she is taking out a loan from HKL to develop this project. In the future, Phin wishes to own a medium farm to raise livestock such as pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of piglets, pig feed and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en: Miss Lieng, age 32, lives together with her mother in Ang Snoul district. Recently she has been working for a garment factory as sewing staff. Besides this career, Lieng takes some spare time to learn to be a seamstress. She has finished this course already. Lieng wants to provide her sewing services to local people from her house. However, she really needs some funds from HKL to invest in this project. With the given funds, she will buy clothes and some necessary tools to start her service. She hopes that our lenders will give her help to develop her business due to experiencing financial lack.

loans.use: to buys clothes and some necessary tools to start her sewing service

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA YECENIA QUIEN VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS CINCO HIJOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION EN DONDE POR MAS DE DOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS Y COMIDA SOLICITA A PRISMA UN PRESTAMO POR LA CANTIDAD DE 6,000.00 PARA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO YA QUE DESEA COMPRAR MAIZ, Y MEJORAR SU COCINA DONDE ELABORA LAS TORTILLAS.
EL PLAZO DE SU PRESTAMO ES DE 10 MESES CON PAGOS MENSUALES
EL SUEÑO DE DOÑA YECENIA ES PODERLE PAGAR LA EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE ESTUDIEN Y SE HAGAN PROFESIONALES.
texts.en:
Yecenia, who lives with her husband and five children, has dedicated herself to selling tortillas and food for more than two years.  She requests a loan through Prisma in the amount of 6,000.00 Honduran lempiras to use as working capital, as she would like to buy corn and make improvements to her kitchen where she makes the tortillas.  The term of her loan is 10 months, with monthly payments.  

Yecenia’s dream is to be able to afford an education for her children so they can grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: tp make improvements to her kitchen and buy corn.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.en:
Sra. Floridalma is married and has two children.  She resides in the neighborhood of El Estero, Alianza Sector, in the Department of Valle.  Floridalma sells various merchandise in her business such as new clothing, cosmetics, school supplies, shoes, tennis shoes, and men’s and women’s footwear.
